Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: victorialynn77
Reviews.Content: Most expensive and least impressive hotel I've ever stayed in. Our room wasn't cleaned very well to start with. There was crumbs all over the floor and hairs in the bathtub. The rooms were a good size but nothing spectacular. The tvs are an older style and ours had a ringing sound every time you turn it on. We couldn't get internet connection in our room because the signal wasn't good enough. Every time we wanted to go online we had to go to the public patio area. The pool was way too cold and way to deep to swim in and the sauna had to be preheated. We waited a half hour and it was still cold. The fitness room was a big disappointment too. The cardio machines were good but they only had ONE free weight. The breakfast buffet was good. For $15 you got coffee, juice, bacon, sausage, eggs, hashbrowns, waffles, fruit, yogurt and more. Definitely worth the price. The staff was really helpful but overall the stay was not worth the price at all.

Reviews.Title: “OK--nothing special”
Reviews.Author: NEWYORKPROF
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a middle of the road type of place. Location is good. Rooms are fine--just nothing special. In sum, convenient and fairly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Stay.........elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: glenhodgso
Reviews.Content: Stayed with two children and despite long-time booking we were on separate floors (6&7). When I asked front desk if they could put us on the sme floor, I just got a shrug and a "no". As for Executive rooms - tiny is the word, old fashioned TV, musty (at best) smelling room that eventhe cleaner had left the window open. Real lack of storage space and the tiniest bathroom I have seen in a H-Inn. No fridge (except locked minibar) ......And then there is the renovations, no bar, no restaurant and when i mentioned that I hadn't seen this when booking I was refereed to a "disclaimer". All in all as a Platinum member of IHGs loyalty scheme with some several thousand hotel nights clocked up in recent years - simply the worst IHG property I've encountered, with the least caring staff. I asked whether any of the rooms had been renovated and was told that some were, but non of these were available. Holiday Inn have a new advertising logo, "Stay....." so my advice, as Americans would say - Don't even think of staing here, Stay.................elsewhere"

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: ibab16
Reviews.Content: When we were checking in at around 10:30 pm the front desk staff was the rudest hotel front desk personnel that I’ve met. He acted as if he was doing us a favour by checking us in. The other front desk staff were courteous and friendly, but the first guy left a sour taste in the mouth. Even after reading mixed reviews I picked this hotel because of the central location. So we were happy about that. We stayed two nights on the 7th floor and seemed like all the renovations were taking place on the 7th floor. The wifi on this floor was weak to non-existing. The connection kept dropping every couple of minutes. Get ready to pay for parking. Again the front desk staff during check-in was arrogant and condescending to us about parking. $20(+ taxes)/night. It’ll take a lot of convincing for me to return to this hotel. There are lot of other options in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Growing Pains”
Reviews.Author: bibi_azim
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location. Close to many amenities and downtown Vancouver. 15 minute away from the Lions Gate Bridge. The hotel is going through extensive renovations. So my experience was a little skewed. The things that were not reno related are the following: Extremely slow internet connection. Pay for printing in the very public business centre. Most hotels have this service for free and in a quite, contained room. Parking is very limited and the spaces are extremely small. Be prepared to find alternative parking after midnight. The cost is $22/night. The elevators are slow. The walls are thin – I heard the occupant next door blowing their nose and rolling out the toilet paper. Huge gap between the door and the floor allowed every noise to be heard. The cable was not available 100% of the time. The staff was very helpful and management did send a welcome basket.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Vancouver- Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenn683
Reviews.Content: My brother and I travelled down to Vancouver and had the priviledge to stay in the great downtown hotel location. We were exploring the city for the first time and it was so central to everything. Stanley Park was not too far of a walk, we got to see different areas of the city and we didn't have to drive. The Front desk made us feel very welcome and we had a great room. They are undergoing some renovations right now that is going to make it even better. They are a top notch hotel and provided really amazing service. Thank you for a great stay Holiday Inn and Suites Vancouver Downtown, we will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Priced well but not the best for business travel”
Reviews.Author: coachboon
Reviews.Content: Like most of you, I'm a member of a limited number of hotel loyalty programs so I like to stay at them when it makes sense to do so. So picking a Holiday Inn for me made sense and it was close to my contact. It was also well priced. Pros: Good value for the dollar, I paid $109 and $119 and that's good anywhere let alone for a major downtown hotel. It was very clean. There are a number of coffee shops in the area and a few local eateries which turned out to be quite good. It's a very short walk to the Granville Entertainment section although parts of the street are somewhat sketchy. Yaletown is a few blocks away. It's also easy to get to the hotel if you use the Skytrain but you will have to walk several blocks. That might be an issue in rainy season. The decor has been updated to a degree and the bed was very comfortable. Cons: This is an old hotel. Lighting levels are poor and the room design reflects it's age. Very small bathrooms, the closet is open right next to the bathroom, small sink. They still use the old tube TV's. I also found the walls to be thin as I could hear conversations quite easily. That having been said, the weekend I was leaving the hotel was booked out. There were traveling teams in for the weekend. It's also a favorite for Canuck fans who where in for the game. So for business, not so great, but for this type of clientele it might be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed at all”
Reviews.Author: georgetown_minky
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at MANY Holiday Inn and everything about my stay was not impressive. location is not very desirable, between the pan-handlers, adult shops and poor view, I wouldnt venture very far at night. Staff picks up phone promptly. I forgot my toothbrush and they brought one up pretty quick. Major stains on CARPET, grout, paint and all sorts of crap (see photo) room smells like paint or adhesive resturant under renovation old tv in room Internet performance will range from; 400 kbps download, 70 kbps upload 10 Mbps download, 4.55 Mbps upload Bathroom: shower head too low, had to position it practically horizontally to wash my hair - and I'm only 5'10" had to jiggle the toilet lever to stop the toilet from running have to really turn the shower valve tight to stop the water scratched tub with grout spots and other construction damage No airport shuttle Called the front desk to ask if all the rooms on my floor are in this condition and was told yes. Emailed the manager to complain Monday night Breakfast is a fairly typical layout - i had the buffet. i think I will just grab something on the way to work - should be way much cheaper. Monday I asked maintenance to come up and fix the toilet, I have to constatntly jiggle the handle to stop the water from running. They were at my door before me, so I let them in and left to get a bite When I returned, my luggage and laptop bag was missing, so I called downstairs and after 20 minutes, got a call back that they moved me to another room. I checked my drawers and my clothes were still there. I checked out the new room and 1000% better than my current room. The manager emailed me about moving me - about 30 minutes after they moved me. No mention of any kind of reimbursement for my troubles. So much about that comment from the front desk that all the rooms are the same. Tuesday AM, no paper this morning in front of my door, but everyone else seems to have one. I grabbed breakfast from the MANY places on my way to work, about half the price of the hotel meal. I understand they are renovating, but even this is too much

Reviews.Title: “Multiple Issues”
Reviews.Author: doc-nm
Reviews.Content: View from the room was very sad with really run down buildings and adult shop ... it was late and kids were tired so we decided to stay ... at night ppl were fighting & shouting outside in back alley ... told reception in the morning and they offered to change rooms ... packed our stuff and left for the day ... room was not ready when we came back and it took two hours before new room was ready ... this room is in front of the building so no noise from the alley but this wing is under construction ... they do try to keep area clean and even sent a little goody basket to make up for it ... today there are too many young people staying on the floor and it's really noisy ... hoping for some peace at night ... let's see? ... 2 b continued :(

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy holiday at holiday inn”
Reviews.Author: Runt d
Reviews.Content: Wow, if you want to hear crack heads fighting over dumpsters and what they find in them, and hearing sirens through out the night, pay a ridiculous amount of money for a room in which the counter top had a chunck taken out of it and was repaired using silve spray paint, uncomfortable beds, I paid less to stay at the MGM grand in Vegas that is ten times better then this, and that little notice that if your stay wasn't good you stay for free, was meet with a laugh and continued billing of $570 for 2 sleepless uncomfortable nights, staff was good and efficient hotel garbage, on a business trip and the hyatt regency we found out later was 130 a night. I doubt I will ever stay again at a holiday inn using my own money.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!! (Not really anything else to say).”
Reviews.Author: InnesDorchester
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed here for a couple of nights after arriving from the UK and prior to an eleven day Rocky Mountaineer 'Grand Circle' train journey (FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE) followed by hiring a self-drive motor caravan (RV - recreational vehicle - as they call them there) for a couple of weeks - another great experience, before returning to Vancouver for another day (night) at the Holiday Inn before our departure from Canada. We cannot praise the Holiday Inn enough, the reception staff gave us a really warm welcome, our room was spotlessly clean, extremely comfortable and well equiped. Throughout our stay we found every staff member to be both friendly and efficient. I think that the 'icing on the cake' was the buffet breakfast, I have visited many hotels over the years and the choice and quality here must rank amongst the very best. The location is ideal being within walking distance of everything you might need.....The prices are reasonable.....If you are looking for somewhere to stay in Vancouver this is the place!!.....You will ENJOY YOUR VISIT.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, and rate”
Reviews.Author: LexiedogHouston
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here one night on business. The check in staff was ver efficient and friendly, even offering me upfront 2pm late checkout since I'm a priority club member. Walkable to lots of decent restaurants. Wireless internet didn't work well in the room but worked great in the lobby and there were lots of comfortable seats to use while on the computer. Across from a Starbucks if that works for you. Room was big and very comfortable. Hotel provides umbrellas, which comes in handy, at least for me this time.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Mat_Meadows
Reviews.Content: I'm giving them 4 stars, and that's a lot better than the 2.5 they have on Yelp It's really better than 2.5 stars, and that's coming from me...a hotelier who has high standards, and is hard to please. The Goods: Location, Location, Location (bars, restaurants and walking distance to the convention center) The service- Not amazing, but better than average. Wei remembered our names the whole time (a party of 3, in different rooms) Water Pressure Comfortable Beds Lots of Pillows They're renovating their rooms.. The Bads: The room could have been cleaner. A used pill holder (plastic with the foil things) on the back.. in the garbage The notepad on the nightstand had been scribbled all over and the pen was missing the cap (not a biggie- but not very detail oriented) The bathrooms are small and cramped...as a guy, it's certainly fine with me Once this hotel completes it's renovation, it'll be a real gem in this neighborhood. It has good bones, just needs some newer finishes. I'd stay here again. & if internet access is important: I'm writing this review from room 411...and no WiFi issues..

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a very convenient spot.”
Reviews.Author: T0J057
Reviews.Content: Very handy to transit and in the middle of Downtown. The bed was comfortable and the rooms were a good size. Staff were very good. We had a very comfortable stay in Vancouver thanks to the Holiday Inn Downtown. It was quiet and very comfortable. Only downfall was the lifts in the main lobby were very small & slow.

Reviews.Title: “I almost drowned in the hotel's pool!”
Reviews.Author: Roxanne C
Reviews.Content: The hotel's pool is horrible! I almost drowned in the swimming pool! The design was very weird, not kid-friendly at all, very small space for kids to swim (3 feet). There is no gradual change from shallow to deep end (3ft/6ft/9ft), irregular curved outlines. Instead of marking it 6ft, it's marked 2m, right next to the 3ft with an irregular curved outline, when I step back I didn't realize it's already 6ft. Those that can't swim and with kids beware, watch your kids and put your floaties on before you dive in this pool. Very disappointed with this hotel, not giving any warnings or signs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, why would you stay anywhere else ?”
Reviews.Author: BGNM
Reviews.Content: Have to agree with other trip advisors this hotels is in the best location and for the price it's hard to beat. They even have rooms to accommodate up to 6 people.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: DGA69
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel though priceline & was pleasantly surprised by the quality. it was a nice sized room in a great location near the local clubs. HOLIDAY INNNN!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Central Tourist-Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: quequedub
Reviews.Content: Nice, central location, convenient to downtown, Vancouver’s West End neighborhood, and the Granville Street and Davie Street entertainment areas. We were a little worried that the location would be a little loud because of its proximity to Granville Street but we didn't experience any issues. At the same intersection at which the hotel sits is also a Starbucks and a coffee shop. The lobby was consistently busy and hectic, with lots of people and groups moving through. It seemed modern and up-to-date enough. The rooms were a bit tired and could use some updating. Nothing wrong with them, they just look like they've not been much thought about for 15 years or so. They were clean and well-kept, though. We found the Holiday Inn & Suites Vancouver Downtown to be perfectly okay. If you're looking for chic, this is not your spot, but, if you're looking for a centrally-located tourist-class hotel, this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lz0j57
Reviews.Content: It's a good place to stay but don't expect the quality that Holiday Inn normally delivers. My family and I, a party of 4 adults recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and the service from one of the staff members at the front desk (Kevin) was most exceptional. However, the service could not make up for the quality of the room, furniture and cleanliness of the room. We were very disappointed that the beds were only doubles and even though they relocated us to the LL2 floor the room looked very much like a run down place. The quality of the furniture was very poor, light stands that didn't work and not enough electrical outlets. Also, the restaurant food (buffet) at breakfast time was cold and very poor quality. It wasn't worth the money we paid for it. However, the service was superb. Because of that, we didn't eat at the restaurant anymore. The concierge services were not helpful especially for first time visitors since they assumed we knew what we wanted to do and we were looking for suggestions. I'd say that after we sent a review to the marketing manager that they explained that they may be renovating the hotel in the near future. Also, in fairness to the hotel, we had just arrived from a stay at another Holiday Inn in Seattle and we had a point of comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelSavvy180
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights and found the front desk and conference staff helpful and friendly. The two major complaints is that the elevators are MUCH too small and the daily waits got tiresome very quickly. The room is a bit tired, but clean; but the bathroom is tiny and the toilet, shower, and sink vanity are all smashed together. But the downtown location is fantastic, everything is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “It has lost me.”
Reviews.Author: POstcardswa
Reviews.Content: Mt wife and I have stayed here on four trips to Canada and always enjoyed the stay. This time (August 2011) it was a huge disappointment. No offer to help with baggage on arrival, non smoking room stank of cigarette smoke ( the whole hotel is supposed to be non smoking) and general feeling of being unwelcome - despite the routine letter from the manager welcoming me as a valued Priority Club member. But the worst part of it all was being abused by the couple who have had the shop concession for years, because I didn't buy my postcards from them and they didn't make any money from selling the stamps I bought. They make the Bali hustlers look like amateurs. And I have marked 'value' as 'poor' because I booked early on the Priority Club website with the supposed early booking discount. I checked before I left and it was much cheaper with no discount on the website than when I booked, and I then tried Expedia and it was cheaper still. I decided that that would be the end of my Priority Club membership, but it was saved by great stays at the Holiday Inn Whistler and the Holiday Inn Express at Riverport Richmond, Vancouver. But its good by to this one despite its great location.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: eddieore
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 day stop here before and after cruising to Alaska and were very happy with everything. The hotel is in a great location,interesting places within walking distance-especially Stanley Park. All staff were really helpful (with only 1 frosty lady at Concierge on 1 occasion) and the Restaurant and Bar staff were especially chatty, friendly and helpful. The swimming pool was an interesting experience, it's really small so I felt like a goldfish going round & round!! Like another poster, we had also some problems with the Internet but staff did come and help us and provide additional free vouchers

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff....Need to fix one thing.....”
Reviews.Author: F B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels worldwide and this is one of the best at making one feel welcome by the attitude of the staff. They are friendly, and responsive. The breakfast buffet is an especially good value if one is a priority club member. The only challenge at this place is the Internet. I had many problems and know that this is an issue they have been trying to deal with by installing new equipment etc. The main point is......the internet works very well in most hotels i go to...HI VAncouver should have figured the Internet out by now - no excuses. It wont be enough to stop me from going back because i know they are committed to figuring it out, but really, it should have been figured out by now. Almost every other hotel already has.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: ThinkingGreenTravel
Reviews.Content: Fee for parking, weird/tiny elevator situation, good service, reasonable rates, wifi was a little slow. Pretty decent breakfast buffet available for purchase. If you're a light sleeper, beware of noisy seagulls in the morning (although you'd probably encounter this same issue in many hotels/parts of Vancouver).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with tea making facilities in rooms.”
Reviews.Author: holidays4all
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with plenty of room space and tea making facilities. The hotel is very tidy with a souvenir shop and there is parking. Beds were very clean and comfortable.We had two children with us and there was a separate room for them. Overall a very good hotel but the parking was not included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, but adequate”
Reviews.Author: gypsybuz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel (we had 2 rooms booked) after the long haul from Australia & before joining Canadian Rockies/Alaskan Tour. The hotel is centrally located to downtown Vancouver which was ideal for us & the Hop-on Hop-off tour bus picked up directly opposite. The hotel staff were friendly & helpful, although we had to struggle up with our luggage on arrival, with no concierge available when we arrived. Our rooms faced the street, however noise was minimal. The rooms were clean, the beds very comfortable & the tariff reasonable for a city hotel. Yes, the hotel is tired and in need of a refurbish, however, we found it more than adequate for our needs and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Changelatitudes
Reviews.Content: The hotel was arranged for us by Rocky Mountaineer before and after our train trip. The location was great - close to nightlife, though not exactly our "speed". We did find good places to eat, though. The area is beautiful and made for great walking. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, we especially enjoyed Tim the bartender. The rooms were clean but smelled like former smoking rooms they tried to disguise.

Reviews.Title: “It was horrible and we won't return”
Reviews.Author: Vaskiyeva D
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel 10 days ago and everything started not bad. It can be seen that the hotel is old and you should wait some time for elevators to come. But the worst started at night. Bed BUGS! On all beds, during all night, lots of them. That can't be even called a normal sleep when you feel these insects going on you and waking up with blood dots on sheets. We said that to reception, they apologized and said that everything will be solved. But, no.. We didn't see them that night but after that started again. With such old wallpaper and furniture it's not surprising. To resolve the problem they should make complete renovation. We felt so sorry that all trip was already paid and we couldn't move to a better place. We will never return here and for your sleep comfort I sincerely advise you to chose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Steve L
Reviews.Content: We had a shorter than expected visit due to airline problems but this was able to be put aside by friendly check-in staff (I think it was Sarah) who pointed us in the direction of good places to eat nearby, even at such a late time. The room we had was comfortable and had an ok view towards the city. With the late sunset and early sunrise, the curtains were dark enough to disguise this. As a traveller from a country where the concept of free wireless internet in hotels is relatively new, it was welcomed to assist us in planning our day on the tourist trail.

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep ever”
Reviews.Author: Girgazim
Reviews.Content: The beds were amazingly comfortable and roomy location is great with protected underground parking and a pool

Reviews.Title: “wifi from the 60ies”
Reviews.Author: nine52
Reviews.Content: the hotel is wonderfully well situated for shopping and eating. The people are very nice! You have to try the waffles for the breakfast. However if you ever need internet access, you will have to go to the Starbucks across the street as the wifi is so slow, we were desesperate. The only time it was working a little bit better was at 4pm, not very convenient. I don't know if it is Canada but I found it expensive for the standard of the room offered.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Bradings
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two friends stayed here for one night before embarking on an Alaska cruise, and again on our return from the cruise for three nights before travelling on the Rocky Mountaineer. We had lovely rooms with excellent facilities and greatly enjoyed the buffet breakfast every day! The hotel was in a very good location for sightseeing and we were able to walk almost everywhere and also caught the hop on hop off tour bus right opposite the hotel. The staff were very helpful although the lady in the gift shop in reception was rather rude and pushy - so we bought our postcards elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Only69Me
Reviews.Content: I came to Vancouver because of business and stayed at Holiday Inn Vancouver Downtown for 1 week. The room I had was large enough, very comfortable and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The buffet serving for breakfast was ok, but not much varieties of food. The best thing is the Location! Even the Hotel is in Downtown, but still it close to the beach and Stanely Park. Every evening I enjoy walking there! Also if u a business person and do not have much time to see the sights you can take a Trolley and the trolley stop is right in front of the Hotel. If you would like to have dinner outside of the Hotel - Davie Street is the best place where to go, there are a lot of restaurants, bars ans clubs and more over it's 3 min to walk. If I visited Vancouver again, I will chose Holiday Inn Hotel and Suites Vancouver Downtown!

Reviews.Title: “What you'd expect from a Holiday Inn...maybe less”
Reviews.Author: x2fr
Reviews.Content: We (wife and 2 yr old daughter) stayed here to attend a wedding for the weekend. Location convenient within downtown and major arterials, although at night the neighborhood didn't seem all that inviting. Our room was a bit tight for a family of 3 and the layout was a bit awkward, our daughter's crib barely fit in an area right by the bathroom door and front door. Weird. The room was sparsely furnished and amenities were very minimal. The sink was terribly small! Actually, the entire bathroom was small. Closets didn't have a door a poorly lit. We had breakfast at the hotel's restaurant. The service was excellent, the waitstaff was very friendly and accommodating. The food, however, was sub par and expensive. I recommend eating outside of the hotel, you'll find a lot of good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Bottom line, the hotel has very friendly staff, the entire place seems well-maintained and clean. However, the rooms are not very spacious and comfortable. it's not a place I would recommend. For how much we paid, we could've stayed at a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, abismal property”
Reviews.Author: Sean K
Reviews.Content: Short and sweet: - Very convenient location. - Friendly, helpful front desk staff (kudos for their willingness to double as concierge - they took the time to go over area map with me) - Decrepit building. Despite a light "refreshing", this hotel hasn't been keep up in a thousand years. Not sure who operates this Holiday Inn, but it ranks in the bottom 5% of chain hotels I've encountered (I stay 100+ nights per year across multiple chains). Would I return? Only if they were the only game in town. And not for a penny over $120/night. This building should be razed. Shame on Holiday Inn for allowing their name to remain on such a disgraceful building.

Reviews.Title: “it was great and we will return”
Reviews.Author: ray s
Reviews.Content: we arrived early in the morning and we couldn;t check in yet so they stored our baggage till we got back and continued our tour of the city.the room was clean and has extra towells . everything went smoothly and we enjoyed ourselves immensley

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely excellent”
Reviews.Author: Judith W
Reviews.Content: I had a suite , which was lovely. It was spotlessly clean, comfortable and pleasantly decorated. Room service was prompt and courteous, and the food was excellent. Staff at check-in and check-out were efficient and cheerful. I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Everything I Wanted & Needed!”
Reviews.Author: Rob H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business. The room was clean and well appointed. The rate was excellent value and the in-room dining was excellent. I would stay at this hotel again when I am back in Vancouver on business. All the associates I encountered were wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jono5565
Reviews.Content: We were extemely disappointed with this hotel, The rooms were old and outdated, the elevators were extemely small and on top of the $200 per night, we also had to pay $20 to park in their parking lot. We were travelling with 2 young kids and we were unable to use the pool because there was only about a 3 foot x3 foot area that was 3 feet deep and the rest of the pool dropped off to 9 feet deep, which is way to deep to be swimming with a 4 and 1 year old. There was no hot tub either at this hotel. The worst part of the stay was that since we were travelling with a 1 year old we needed a microwave in our room, All other hotels we have stayed at will bring a microwave to our room free of charge. This joke of a hotel wanted to charge us $20 to have microwave in our room for a night. I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Practices”
Reviews.Author: Abened
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 2 pm and we not allowed to check in untill 4pm (there is no check in times posted on their website) We had to find something to do until that time, not to mention parking in Vancouver is hard, even more so since our car could not fit in their parking garage so we had to park in an open lot across the street. when we got to our room our air conditioner did not work and seeing it was summer and very warm outside and we were walking around for a few hours until we checked in, we could not cool down very well. It took them 2 hours to find us another room with a working air conditioner. The rooms were clean, and finally it was a relief to go to bed on the first night. The next day after a long day of touring the city - Tuesday mind you, We had dinner and headed to bed around 7pm and when we got to our room we could not go to bed. There was some sort of party in the bar below us till 2am in the morning. If it were the weekend I would not have been so bad as there would have been more for us to do in the evening, but a Tuesday and the next day we had to drop a friend off at the airport. They should have a least let us know ahead of time or not put us in that particular room. Most places have a say in what can go on in the building especially a hotel holding the majority of the space that is being used, as they would want their customers coming back. It was horrible for us and we were exhausted from our 3 day vacation not rested/relaxed. Be careful when booking this hotel for your stay and ask a lot of questions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: PenelopeTravels!
Reviews.Content: After a cruise in May, we wanted to stay in Vancouver for the weekend to explore the city for the first time. The room we had was large and very comfortable. The staff was very friendly, and holding our luggage on our last day was no problem (as well as very secure). The gentleman running the gift shop (which seriously contains any item a person could possibly want) was very friendly and helpful. The Holiday Inn on Howe proved to be a wonderful location for a exploring the city. *The hop-on/hop-off trolley stops right in front of the hotel (recommended by the gentleman running the gift shop), which was a really fun way to see the sights. We ended up going around on both routes, and made a point to go through Stanely Park twice. The first day it was a bit rainy so we went back the second day and were able to hop off and enjoy the beauty of the parks *The very convenient Bus #6 runs down Davie Street, which is full of restaurants and shops. We took it to visit the wonderful Rain City Grill (an exceptional dining experience). *One of the best brunches I've ever had was found right behind the hotel at the Twisted Fork Bistro. Yes, the neighborhood gets a little, um, interesting as you go around the block behind the hotel, but we felt very safe. Expect a wait at the Twisted Fork - totally worth it. If we visited Vancouver again, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Neat, Tidy and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: 2010Patricia
Reviews.Content: While all downtown Vancouver hotels are expensive, the Holiday Inn on Howe Street is in a great location and convenient to almost every part of downtown (unlike those very expensive hotels on the water). While it is not cheap, it is not overpriced for the location and the nice rooms. The beds are lovely, the staff are splendid and the hotel is clean; the parking lot is easily accessible. However, if you stay there and are a light sleeper, ask for a room far away from the elevator as I was kept awake most of the night, not by the guests coming and going, but by the elevator hydraulics that I couldn't hear until I was already in bed and the evening was late, ie, too late to change my room without a lot of inconvenience. I must add that the hotel management was very responsive to my complaint after the fact.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat frustrated”
Reviews.Author: MiaLillooet
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family room with my daughter and her husband for one night. The hotel is in downtown, and has a super location. The room is spacious with an additonal smaller room with a twin bed and a pull out bed as well. This was handy to store luggage and to have some privacy to change. The bathroom is very tiny. The room however, was not 'ready' for use. We had to phone housekeeping for some coffee and a remote control for the tv. There were two teabags, for a family of four and one stir stick. In the bathroom was one tiny bar of soap for the bathroom and adjacent basin. Parking fee is $20 which is good until 6 pm on the day of check out.

Reviews.Title: “A tip of the hat to two girls at the front desk!”
Reviews.Author: NimsM
Reviews.Content: The location is great, a hop, skip and jump away from restaurants and night spots. But that proximity to the party zone means it can get noisy in some rooms. I had this problem the first night, which kept me awake. I asked to be switched to a different room the next day, and that was much better, even though it was the night of Game 7. The staff are polite and friendly. Kudos to two in particular - Julia and Katie at the front desk. These girls have such a wonderful attitude, "can-do" attitude. When I told a male staff about the noisy room and asked for a change, he said he would tell the night auditor, and added that I would have the problem in any room that night because of Game 7. When I mentioned it a little later to Julia, she immediately made arrangements to switch rooms and have my things moved. Katie, who checked me in, saw me look at some maps on the stand, and immediately produced a much better one, asked me what I was interested in, and gave very detailed directions, and suggested places that she thought I would like. I hope the management realize what an asset these girls are to the hotel. If not for them, I would have given this place three stars overall.

Reviews.Title: “Was not what i was looking for”
Reviews.Author: Klindatheau
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights from June 5, to June 10, 2011. I could not believe how noisy it was. I showed up because i could not stay at the Sheraton Wall Centre for 5 days, only 4 of the 5 days were open so i gave the Downtown Holiday Inn a show. I got fast check in service. But when i got to the room, it was hald the size of a Sheraton room... The bathroom was small, and the sink was near the closet. But i had a 2 double beds that i am use too. But what grossed me out was the view. I swear there was a hoarder across the way that was storing their world on the roof of a business. Plus there is a couple bars/restaurants and people are out back smoking cigarettes in the late evening to 2am. What was really annoying was that i thought i was going to pay $140 a night.... as i had a pamplet that said a $140 a night that was given to my company on late may. So when my room came to only $144/nite using my BCAA, So I wonder if i got the business rate - would i have gotten a better room? I like the location but i was not a fan of the parking, and internet. Internet times out alot, and parking was really tight. Plus i would have liked Valet parking. So it was disheartening for me to see i was 2 blocks from Sheraton Wall Centre. What was sick to see was a old dude walking around in his under-wear outside the hotel.... and then being arrested by Vancouver PD.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant Nice, Staff Very Helpful”
Reviews.Author: buffie46
Reviews.Content: Not all rooms have fridge, ours did but our friends who were travelling with us did not have a fridge, so if this is important to you check before you book. Hotel very central to all you might need. Hop On Hop Off Big Bus stops opposite hotel. We ate in hotel restaurant one night, had Pizza, very good.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls but no major issues”
Reviews.Author: aimoverseas
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in Vancouver for a conference at the convention center. The Holiday Inn is about 8-10 blocks (~15 minutes walk) from the harbour and convention, so not right nearby but not too far. I had a room on the third floor. The bed was very comfortable and room was really spacious - perfect for business where you just want to unpack everything. Free wireless is definitely a plus and the room servicing was good. The bathroom was a little cramped by had a fabulous, instantly hot shower. Some people might find the rooms a little dated, but I thought it was ok. I was a little surprised to be able to pretty clearly hear people in the next room - particularly in the bathroom or when lying in bed. Fortunately my neighbours weren't TOO noisy so it didn't pose a problem. I was also a bit surprised to find a note above the room fan system (no a/c) saying something to the effect of 'open the window if it's too warm'. Still, a very reliable stay, friendly staff and comfortable night of sleeping. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for downtown & Granville Island”
Reviews.Author: clemandjanice
Reviews.Content: Caught the skytrain from the airport to City Centre Station northbound on the Canada line - very easy, and then a 10 min walk to the hotel. Slightly disappointed that our room wasn't ready at 3pm, but went for a nice coffee at a nearby Waves coffee bar. As a Priority Club Member, we were given an upgrade to a suite. The room was huge, but the sitting room part of it didn't have windows so we mainly used it as a storage area. All other amenities were exactly as one would expect, including a proper kettle, iron and ironing board. Wireless internet access was free. Had a look at the pool, but didn't find it attractive; it seemed to have been tucked away in a distant corner and was very small. We were very close to the seafront, having easy access to False Creek and the seawall walkway which goes all the way around Stanley Park. We walked to Granville Island but caught the little boat back to False Creek. Tickets for various attractions, including the Capiiano Bridge-to which there's a free shuttle bus- are cheaper at the Visitor Information Office at Canada Place.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Decent Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Kreeny80
Reviews.Content: Date of stay: May 19-23, 2011 Overall rating: 7.5/10 Having stayed at many Holiday Inns (and even Intercontinentals) I was expecting a little more from this hotel, especially since it has the new "HI" branding. I realise there is only so much a hotel can afford to renovate at one time, but I do know that certain items (like an old TV) should not have passed through the brand inspection. That being said, it is still a very fine hotel, clean and a wonderfully central location in Downtown Vancouver. Only blocks away from Robson and many shopping opportunities, as well as the wealth of downtown eateries. If you're not driving, the buses and SkyTrain are not far away at all. Staff were friendly, attentive and I always got a smile. Thanks to Candy in the restaurant as her breakfast service was great. We did have a rental car, and yes parking is extra, but it's certainly cheaper than any other locations close by and is quite secure. We had a king-bed room and were quite comfortable. The wifi can be a little sketchy in places, but I could always find a spot in the room to use my laptop. The bathroom was clean, but the tile and bathtub need updating. Overall there are a lot of areas that are perfectly serviceable/clean/comfortable - but need updating to the new "HI" standards. One would think they'd have done this in preparation for the 2010 Olympics. All in all, great value for your money - wonderful location - needs some updating.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Downtown Option”
Reviews.Author: rjc260
Reviews.Content: We thought the Holiday Inn was a decent affordable option for downtown. Our room was clean and fairly large. The decor in our room was neutral and there was a doorwall that faced the street but no balcony. The bathroom was bright and clean but pretty small. The only annoying issues with the room were the loud fan in the bathroom and the older (and smaller) tv that was situated at an odd angle relative to the bed. The exercise room at the hotel wasn't the greatest but there was a note that they have improvements in store for the area. There was also a small pool that looked enticing for kids. A relatively plain looking bar and restaurant were situated off the lobby but we didn't check out either during our stay. I believe parking was $18 per day but we opted to use street parking, given the short duration our car would be parked (street parking is 2 hours max with paying hours 9am-10pm seven days a week). The hotel is conveniently situated - only a five minute walk to Yaletown for dining and drinking options. Overall we were happy with our stay at the Holiday Inn and would recommend the hotel to others, especially if you aren't looking for a luxurious or trendy option.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, easy walk everywhere. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: medtravler
Reviews.Content: Was a good location for a quick trip to vancouver. fairly fast (and green) trip from the airport. Rooms were clean. Didnt use the bar-restruant downstairs. room service was ok. The pool wasnt bad, but awkwardly located, no restrooms near by for little ones. close to trolly stops.

Reviews.Title: “Good economical choice for downtown”
Reviews.Author: SDMomof3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location easy walking distance to shops and places to eat etc. The rooms themselves are just ok... kind of dated but reasonably clean. The staff was beyond good. Helpful, nice and super friendly. We were travelling with small kids so the breakfast buffet and pool were great. All in all, I would definitley book there again. It is an economical choice for downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice. Clean. Close to everything. Great Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Rodbh71
Reviews.Content: Hi there! Stayed there for 4 days while visiting Vancouver. Rooms are clean, staff heldep us with everything. Excellent location, close to public transportation and to the city attractions, although it is located on a quiet street. Will stay again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Stay in the entire trip US/Canada”
Reviews.Author: Tanmay
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were really rude and non-co-operative. We reached the hotel late at night from the airport. The check in staff were very IMPOLITE and didnt care at all about guests. We also got a room where the airconditioning did not work at all. After complaining several times, they offered us a Table Stand Fan for the entire night. They did not give us another room or did not call a mechanic or engineer to fix the airconditioning. Hotel staff were unapologetic about it. We were told " This is what we have best, just take it or leave it". Though our booking was for four days, we shortened it to only two days. Location of the hotel was good, in the Vancouver downtown. Close to all nightlife and shopping streets. Some of the buses also have this hotel as their main stops, so it helps if you are travelling out of Vancouver. Hotel is completely run down and needs a lot of maintenance and renovation. We would never ever stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot, Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: CCheltenham
Reviews.Content: Pros: Amazing location! Right downtown, easy walk to anything in downtown Vancouver. I had a ton of bags, but it was very easy by the Skytrain to and from the airport. Cons: Tiny Room. This thing was a closet. Not a big deal for me because I just needed a place to rest my head and leave my bags, but WOW it was tiny. Definetly not for the claustrophobic. The room was very clean. Hot water did not work at first, but after I spoke to lady at the front desk they had it up and running in short order. This is a great place if you want to see all that downtown Vancouver has to offer, and just need a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.... love this place!”
Reviews.Author: mamabrear
Reviews.Content: I only have excellent things to say about this hotel and my many stays... the staff are always polite and extremely friendly, the rooms are so clean and the amenities make it very convenient to stay here. Their 'Kids eat Free' makes it very affordable to enjoy the excellent food in the restaurant too, and the kids love the pool! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants an affordable upper scale hotel in the Downtown area. thanks to the hotel for outdoing themselves once again!

Reviews.Title: “If you aren't picky and can get a deal, then this hotel is a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: dk0815
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, easy access to Granville Island Aquabus and all of downtown walking. We liked the location although at night it was a bit sketchy on Granville and Helmcken. It also looks like there is a half-way house/shelter one block away on Howe. None of that really bothered us. The hotel is older and trying to renovate. We had new furniture, bathroom fixtures, paint, and carpet in the room but the doors were old and chipped, and the room had popcorn like ceilings. You could still see the age. The halls were a bit noisy, as this hotel seemed to have lots of 19-somethings there to party, and we could hear talking next door. At night we never heard a thing and it was very quiet! Overall, no issue with noise. The parking was tight and the garage costs $20 per night. The height limitation is 6 feet. Our 4-Runner fit just fine. The lobby bar was a fine spot to go and get a drink. The bartender was really funny and fun to talk to. The bar closes around 9 but the bartender stayed late on both nights we were there because there were people in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Hoping to return one day”
Reviews.Author: JetlaggedPete
Reviews.Content: After spinning the globe too many years alone on business this was the families first visit to Vancouver. Always hard travelling with others with all the different expectations and long haul plays hell with the body clock. Even harder getting myself into vacation mode. This hotel from my first email query to checkin through daily service was exceptional. Staff had the friendliest can do attitude that endured for the entire stay. As far as Holiday Inns go this place was a great pick. In fact for a hotel with a few years under the belt...service quality wise its right up there! Top marks also for them acknowledging my long past priority club membership (other establishments take note). The place is clearly popular as I witnessed on one night some walk ins being kindly referred elsewhere due to full house. The rooms were comfortabe and especially clean. Noise...well I expected disturbed nights due to its locale, so pleasantly surprised to report no problems of note. The design is a bit of a rabbits warren and lifts a tad small, but again no hassle. Bit taken aback one evening to come back to what appeared to be an upmarket pre xmas function happening (didn't think the place could hold so many revellers) but again no hassles or disturbance. The food was good and friendly service to match. The hotels position means that you can walk in almost any direction and find dining (including takeaway or supermarket) and entertainment options. The internet was being upgraded so we had problems, but some free vouchers to the foyer computers some evenings and a late night service call (we returned very late one evening...many thanks!!) from IT found the old lan cable under the bed and we were very happy. Goodness how did tourists cope pre internet days? Surprised to discover they have dedicated tourist desk staffed quite often with folk who really knew the place....great advice. So in summary what I was expecting to be an older business hotel in the cusp of a noisy down at heel part of town..far from it. What a gem...gotta go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Cheap Price”
Reviews.Author: Jimgotkp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two days with the family during our vacation in Vancouver. Received a great rate of ~$72 a night per room which were both basic double rooms since it was a F&F rate. The rooms were a bit dark would be nice if better lighting was offered. The rooms were still somewhat spacious. The location was superb since it was just one block away from Granville St. The rooms were also quite noisy since it's close to the clubs and nightlife spots. Parking was available for PC members upon entrance into the garage which was a nice touch since I'm a PC member. I was not happy with two things though. The first being the free internet, I understand it's being upgraded/renovated right now but it was VERY slow during the day while disconnecting at times. I'm also not happy with the happy hour that included appetizers I was entitled to as a PC member at the lounge on the main floor. Why I wasn't happy was because there was NO appetizers since it was the holidays. However, I received a letter upon check-in which said there was appetizers and I was able to enjoy around 5PM? Why not edit the letter beforehand if it is not being offered? My family and I waited in the couches outside the lounge for around 15-20 minutes too since we weren't sure if the lounge was actually open as well. Would be nice if signs were put up or employees would approach guests who seem to be confused with things like us. I understand it's a HI not a IC hotel but little things like that can boost a hotel's reputation like no other.

Reviews.Title: “Too many fire alarms and condoms in the mini bar :(”
Reviews.Author: PaulAtkin
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here 3 times on business and pleasure. Location is good - v. close to Granville Island and short walk to Downtown. There were 2 or 3 fire alarms (full evacuation of the hotel) in a 4 day stay and the mini bar, in addition to the usual drinks + snacks included condoms. I wouldn't stay again with family and dislike the implication as a business traveller. Will try a different Holiday Inn next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to public transport, shops, dining and sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: LibbyAlbury
Reviews.Content: Comfortable large rooms . We had a business room on a higher level. Plenty of space - clean and comfortable. Wireless internet free but in the rooms not good service - had to go out into the hall and downstairs to see the AFL grand final - take 2!! Underage teenager so couldn't go to the sports bars - a true Collingwood supporter!! Great shopping streets near by. Hop on Hop Off bus a great way to see sights. Granville Island and Stanley PArk were great and could have spent more time if we had it. Breakfast not included but easy access to great places downtown. Restaurant OK at the Hotel. No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: opium05
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my mom and aunt for a short weekend. The location was located close to the ferry to grandville island and just 10 min away from the shopping centers downtown. The pool was deep which was nice but we had to call for towels. The sauna never got really hot either. The onsite restaurant was very good, but not wonderful. For breakfast i recommend going to the twisted fork around the corner but get there when it opens or you will have to wait.

Reviews.Title: “Convienient spot”
Reviews.Author: JAckhoner
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the downtown Holiday Inn on Howe street while down on business. I found the hotel clean & the staff very friendly and helpful. Also the location of this property is perfect for anything happening downtown. Strongly would recomend this hotel for anybody staying in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “great spot and close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: ynaut
Reviews.Content: neede a clean room close to downtown Vancouver and the HI was a perfect spot. would stay again when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Employees made me feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: Bond1942
Reviews.Content: I usually measure a service establishment by how engaging the employees are. At this hotel everyone from the maintenance staff to the front desk personnel made immediate eye contact and spoke directly to me. My rooms were a suite and were very comfortable with everything I needed. Perhaps the furniture slightly overwhelmed the rooms and probably could have been reduced but it was comfortable. The location allows guests to walk easily to many of the cities main attractions and is close to the excellent Sky Train service to the North Shore and suburbs. Soon the transformation of nearby Granville street will be complete and no doubt will enhance the amenities close to the hotel. Nevertheless, we walked to two excellent restaurants nearby, one which was recommended by the front desk staff. The least attractive feature is that there are at least 3 elevator sites available, which is a good thing for fast travel, but no clear signing where each one will deposit you on the lower levels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: pgadbois
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn at the corner of Howe and Helmcken last week for 3 days of budgets. Gruelling to say the least. However, returning to the hotel in the evening was a highlight. Employees consistently calling me by name, Roy in the restaurant always joking about the weather (which was great by the way) and my room being impeccably clean. All in all, everything I look for in a hotel when I am there on business. And being 3 blocks away from the action of Yaletown is a great bonus too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: stuart100100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights and then for a further 3 nights after returning from Whistler, upgraded to a suite on the first stay as I am a Gold Priority Club member. This was my second visit to the Holiday Inn Downtown in as many years and the experience was once again top notch; the Hotel was spotless, rooms were clean spacious and being upgraded to a suite was extemely welcome. The staff without exception were friendly, helpful and attentive to our needs. The location was fine for us, 10-15 minute walk to downtown and the waterfront, 1 block away from the nightlife on Granville St Will defintely stay here again when I return to Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: kerriebear
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel i stay before and this time is was for medicane reason it was a two suites with my mum was so happy room serivce was great

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and efficient hotel - recommended”
Reviews.Author: mish_carrington
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, clean decor and great location. Ideal for sightseeing holidays, hotel is a little out of town so a little quieter in location. Resturant nice for breakfast - do not know about evening meals as alway out for dinner. Staff friendly and helpful, even has a mini tourist info desk to assist with trip suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Living in luxury at only half the price”
Reviews.Author: Greek-goddess2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the holiday inn express for a family wedding and the rooms were very spacious and nicely updated. We had the best sleep because the bed was very comfortable!!! The booking process was easy and they were able to accomodate all of our family at this one location.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered and enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: mgamula
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a parlour suite for a week. Great central location, quiet, VERY large suite. A smallish hotel with personalized, exceptional service from all staff. The room was expansive and calming, with lots of light. The furnishings: bed, pillows, furniture, bath robes(!), oversized mirrors, were exceedingly plush and comfortable. Cleaning staff: professional and considerate. Breakfast was great: fresh, lots of variety, incredibly friendly, hard-working staff, very attentive. Front desk was efficient, polite, and knowledgeable. For serious exercising, there's a large gym one block away. A few minutes' walk to good restaurants on Davie. Enjoyed the hotel as it's a good antidote to the large, depersonalized hotels. They make a serious effort to look after all your needs. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly and efficient service... little room for improvement!”
Reviews.Author: jobird1979
Reviews.Content: The service both on reception and in the restaurant/bar (particularly Tim!) was excellent - professional at all times, friendly and helpful. I found the lady who operated the tour advisory centre in the reception area particularly helpful also, she was knowledgeable about the local area and attractions and was more than happy to help me to book my tour. The location of the hotel is ideal; easy walking distance to both sides of the city, shops, bridges and beaches. My hotel room was situated directly next to the elevators, so was unfortunately slightly noisy as a result, however this was the only negative. The room was a very good size, well equipped, clean and comfortable. The best part of the stay was the service we received in both restaurant and bar - friendly, efficient, and nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Room - very comfortable. King Bed - just right. Housekeeping service - top notch.”
Reviews.Author: Ageilly
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - convenient to shopping. Convenient to the new Canada Line.

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: wrldtvler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on priceline for $56 plus tax a night which is a good deal obviously. Parking is $20 and the garage seems a little shady for some reason. Our room was on the second floor and was virtually silent from the noise of the street or nearby bars. I believe this was because we faced directly south. The room was fine, a bit small and dated, the bed was terrible, I think the place is due for a reno. The pool looked alright and the staff was nice. The location is pretty good only a block off of Granville St. This certainly is not a family friendly location if people are wondering. This area of Granville St is the 'entertainment' district, meaning bars, restaurants and porn stores right around the corner. So it is great if that is what you are in town for. I would certainly stay here again and would have given a higher rating if the bed didn't have an uncomfortable groove in it. Just remember it is a Holiday Inn and in a party area of town and your expectations will be met.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff with strange layout”
Reviews.Author: Traci422
Reviews.Content: The front desk was friendly and helpful, the breakfast buffet was fantastic. The fresh fruit was spectacular and our waitress was extremely sweet and attentive. The hotel is set up a little strangely so getting to the fitness center or pool can be a little tricky. We got on the wrong elevator and had trouble finding the front desk until we went up and around the conference center, then down some stairs. We later realized that another set of elevators would take us where we needed to go. We experienced a horrific smell on the first floor during this little adventure and felt bad for any guests staying on that floor. Just as the hotel has a bit of a strange set up we had trouble with the parking lot as well. It’s as if at one point this was two buildings that have been combined to form one hotel. The hotel could use a good deep cleaning, but overall things were good and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Steveh35
Reviews.Content: The service I received was top notch. The hotel is conveniently located for my business meetings & the value I received for what I paid is better than I get in other major cities.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed. Could hear people in bar on Granville.”
Reviews.Author: abenzvi
Reviews.Content: Most of the staff were nice. Didn't like how the cleaning lady left the sliding door open (came back to four flies in the room on day 3). The room was OK (a bit of a mouldy smell whenever the air conditioner turned on and from the fridge...not sure if it was a fridge.) Security wasn't too good. We were robbed our fourth day there and someone made off with our laptops and car. All we got were a few movie passes in an attempt to make us feel better (which I did not really feel like using given the circumstances) and, I felt, a big screw you. We could also hear the bar goers from a block over. Too close to the sketchy area for my liking -- I wouldn't exactly call it a "family friendly" neighbourhood. OK for clean (except for the mouldy smell). Wouldn't let the kids go into that pool again. They got a rash. The night staff and restaurant staff were nice though. I should've paid a little more for a really nice (safe) place.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: BcOldsport
Reviews.Content: We were somewhat concerned with several of the negative reviews but were favourably impressed overall. While we only stayed one night, the front desk service was prompt and attentive (try to get Wei) and restaurant service equally so. The hotel interior IS dated and a little 'dowdy' but more important, the room while small was clean and so was the bathroom. The beds were fine with 'firm' mattresses and very clean linen. There was very little street or hotel interior noise so we slept soundly.It was also one of the hottest days on record for Vancouver but the central A/C worked perfectly. Yes- the elevators are slow and small but a minor inconvenience . The property's relative central location provides good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: deb-5584
Reviews.Content: Came for my daughter 16 th birthday. Good location hotel, clean, nice lobby, small swimming pool, a little confusing stairs and elevator, but once you got it, you will be OK. Overall good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and convenient family hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dsnewtime
Reviews.Content: Just spent the night at the Holiday Inn & Suites, Downtown Vancouver BC. I was with my five year old granddaughter, who was pretty impressed with the whole thing, especially the pool! We were on the seventh floor, very quiet, lovely room. Bathroom slightly small, but not a real problem. Very comfortable bed to sleep in. Nicely decorated, clean, surprisingly quiet for downtown. The staff that we dealt with were excellent. We ate all our meals, lunch dinner, breakfast, in the hotel restaurant, which was just fine. Not excellent, but with a five year old, you want simple. and kids eat for free, which was a nice touch. The food at dinner was surprisingly good. Breakfast buffet, also very good, A little more $$ than I thought it should be at $16.95 each, but really, a pretty good deal. Location is good. A few blocks up from the main stem, Close to shopping, theatres, and only a bus or taxi away from Stanley Park etc. My ONLY complaint, and it's a very small one... the elevators are VERY slow!! We took the stairs at one point because we got tired of waiting. It's a very small complaint. Mostly we were both very impressed with the overall quality and comfort of this hotel. My granddaughter pronounced it "swanky" High praise indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location (Safe), but not all 3 star hotels are created equal !”
Reviews.Author: Peter7248
Reviews.Content: Great location, I felt very safe! Lots of places to eat close by! Starbucks across the street. (Tim Horton's a few blocks away.) On Davie street you could walk to: an exchange place, Denny's, Safeway Grocery Store, and a 24 hour London Drugstore. This was my first time at a Holiday Inn, and it was just "OK". I won a priceline bid, so the value was excellent, but not all 3 star hotels are created equal! (If you ever stayed at a Marriott, this is a down-grade!). The bathrooms and the TV needed updated! Very tiny elevators! The room was clean, and the bed comfortable; Good for a few nights. My room was quiet, and I did not hear anything from the other rooms. I had a view of the back alley / dumpsters. I took the train from Seattle (very relaxing), so I stayed for 2 nights, but took a later train for the 3rd day, and stored my luggage at the hotel. My favorite place in Vancouver is Stanley Park. (There is a Starbucks at the Westin Hotel right by Stanley Park). My favorite place to eat is : Pickwick's on Denman street for Fish & Chips, I also like the Spaghetti Factory, by the steam clock. I would rate this hotel just average, for the price I paid, it was well worth it! Walking distance to everything!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Needs updating!”
Reviews.Author: Shangheye
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly and helpful, location was great- short walk to Granville Island ferries, Yaletown, Gastown and Robson. Hotel itself a little dated though, corridors smelled musty and carpets were filthy. Don't walk around your room in bare feet! Sound proofing between rooms is inadequate, we could clearly hear the conversations and more from the couple next door, which was certainly an education for our children! We got free parking and breakfasted at the Java Express next door (which had faster wifi too). Adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but quite dated”
Reviews.Author: AH1111
Reviews.Content: OK for a cheap overnight & pretty central, but is now looking dated & things like the in room films quite expensive. Was allowed to check in early, but the room pretty stuffy & small so was glad it was only for one night. Clean, but the decor, carpets, bath rooms etcs seem a little shabby but probably ok for the £60 I got it through hot wire. Next time though will probably shell out more & get some where better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: diverez
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better Holiday Inn's I've stayed in. The hotel is modern and clean. The staff is courteous. The pool and exercise room are above average, the sauna is a neat amenity. The hotel's restaurant and room service is decent. Location is great, its only a few blocks from the SkyTrain which if you are traveling in by the airport you may want to just try the Vancouver mass transit, its very efficient. It made getting to and from the airport very easy. I also rented a car and found that the commutes were longer and the hotel does charge for parking. One negative aspect was the wireless internet was a little spotty at times.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: BlueHooligan
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous comments in the reviews about wearing ear plugs. At 8:00 a.m. we could hear the entire conversation that our neighbour was having over the phone. At night, this same neighbour was singing by himself, which was crystal clear in our room. We haven't experienced such thin walls from a hotel in the $120/ night price category and would expect this from a cheesy motel for $50. Our major complaint was when a family jumped in the pool wearing shorts, t-shirts, underwear, along with a baby in a diaper. My husband and I were looking forward to an evening swim when this sight appeared before our eyes we changed our mind. When speaking to the hotel staff about this situation it was stated that, "who are we to say that they can't wear their clothes in the pool?" and I was questioned as to whether or not I really saw a diaper and not a pull up. Needless to say, I felt that my issue was unheard and she also said that, "they do not supervise the pool area and someone would go down to take a look at the diaper issue". Well, if you don't supervise the pool area, who does? Over and over it was stated in the hotel guide and all over holiday inn material that if for some reason you were not satisfied with your stay they would make it better. I was sorry I complained because this hotel employee treated me rudely and did not see this problem as an issue. I'm sorry, but I am not swimming with others who are in their sweaty clothes, most likely stained old underwear, and a diaper with who knows what in it. If you are going to stay here, as stated, this hotel does not supervise the pool area so feel free to do what you want in this area. Hop in fully clothed, bring your glass bottles down, and hey don't bother getting out of the pool to go the bathroom. My advice - For $120 a night try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not memorable”
Reviews.Author: AFLtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a month while working on the Olympics. It never felt like home, but nor was I desperate to get out of the place. The good: the food in the restaurant is OK, not huge portions but OK. There's a small giftshop and a friendly bar. The hotel's location is good, just out of the main drag and up a couple of blocks from the bustling Yaletown. The bed was comfy. The average: no minibar in many rooms, ageing decor, strange layout. Friends reported that the "suites" were "studios", with the advantage of a kitchenette but a bed that folded out from the wall and took all the remaining space. The bad: the hotel doesn't cope with too many guests - often barely any hot water at night, restaurant struggled when only 4 tables were full, free wifi is slow when there are too many users and there's no faster, more reliable, paid option in the room. Indeed the wi-fi failed a number of times in one week during my stay but all the desk staff want to do is put you through to off-site tech support (thanks, but it's not my problem, it's yours!). Had to get the manager to sort it out instead. Don't even think of using Skype either. On check-in my phone didn't work, a lightglobe had blown and I had a faulty desk chair - all of which were rectified that day.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for the budget traveller.”
Reviews.Author: letterdude
Reviews.Content: As I was traveling solo - for a change - I decided to take a chance on a 3 star rated hotel, as it offered a location that suited my needs. I had a 2 night stay (Monday & Tuesday). This is not a newer hotel, but it has been fairly well maintained. The lobby is nice and has a restaurant/bar attached. Only 7 floors. Pros: Downtown - close to everything Excellent service from staff (really!) Good food Clean Great bed Less expensive rates Lots of hot water Nice swimming pool (but small) Decent workout equipment and sauna Covered smokers patio area (2nd floor) Cons: Below average soundproofing (traffic noise) Small rooms Really small bathroom Dated furnishings (chairs, lamps, etc.) Poor TV signal/old TV No hot tub Small, slow elevators Poor business center In truth, I had a nice stay. Had my wife been with me, she'd have been upset at the bathroom size and audible street noise. Earplugs are recommended. The room, while small, was neat, clean and well- attended. The area, while conveniently located, is a little run-down. I went out evenings - walking - without any problem whatsoever. As I have enrolled in several hotel chain "club" plans, including the Holiday Inn's, I was able to take advantage of a free available room upgrade. Since these plans are - usually - free, it makes good sense, especially in combination with discounted online rates. Based on the service, price and bed, I would recommend this hotel for budget travellers with some tolerance for minor imperfections.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Vancouvers best bet,, no doubt”
Reviews.Author: 8baller
Reviews.Content: People who really make you feel at home. Most hotels try, but this one actually does. From the front desk (Maggie, Wei, Diana and more) to the restaurant (Jesse, Roy, Candy and more) it feels like a second home. The hotel is in a great location for all downtown activities. Forget the car and walk to your destination. Reasonably priced and deliver each and every time..

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but noisy location”
Reviews.Author: Ktoto_KD
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice location in downtown Vancouver but there is Central Hospital near the hotel. We could see and hear helicopters landing on hospitals' roof and sirens' noise was very laud - we were awakened many, many times during the night. Other than that, our room was clean, the staff was friendly, check in was accurate and very fast. But because of the very night-time-noisy location we can't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional staff”
Reviews.Author: trip1997
Reviews.Content: A guy checking in parked in front of a no-parking sign on the only driveway entering parking lot. We horned, he came out, moved car, got off car and started an argument with us. Mark, Manager on shift, walked by and asked him to move car. Mark didn't care to hear the whole story from us, said he didn't know the situation and told us to stop yelling. This Manager deeply needs a course on conflict management and hospitality professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Awful Room & Service”
Reviews.Author: RuthMag
Reviews.Content: We were checked in efficiently, but were horrified at the condition of the room. Dripping wet walls, mold around window, on curtains & all over bathroom. And the service was far less than accomodating. I would never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Cant Get it Right”
Reviews.Author: DaveFrancis
Reviews.Content: If you look at earlier reviews I have made,I stayed here before. I gave this hotel bad marks, and, well, it hasnt got much better. So, I can be brief: Booked online thenight before with a AAA rate. about 127.00 CAN. We arrived for a Saturday night, and I noticed the lobby had been slightly remodeled. I asked about when this occured, and the front desk staff said it was recently done to promote a new Holiday Inn Logo. They were very proud and helpful, which made check in delightful. The room appeared clean on the initial walk in, however a serious odor. This was room 409 in case you wish to avoid it. Smelled like Body Odor. I know it sounds wierd, but the three of us concurred. I also noticed the room was not spotless...but was clean enough...it was just that smell. Opened the window and left for several hours and it did not help....Just made me feel uncomfortable. I see they have upgraded the linens bedding and pillows,whichwas nice except for the pillow labels being dirty. Again, a wierd thing to notice. The bathrooms and tubs have beenremodeled as well whichmakes me believe Holiday Inn Vancouver is trying to upgrade. I just dont feel like it is the cleanest hotel in the area. You know, the staff here is great, and there are no really serious problems with this hotel....it just gives me the creeps. I try tobe objective, and applaud their trying to upgade this property, but I simply cant get comfortable here. In any event, this hotel should hover at the89.00 dollar range. Seriously, any more spent is bad money. Sorry Holiday Inn...I love you....but lower the rates for this particular property. And 15.00 a night to park is wayyy too much to park in that dimly lit filthy garage. I gave you another chance, and I will make other arrangements next time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable 3 star, good location”
Reviews.Author: ZippLiners
Reviews.Content: PROS: Three blocks from Robson St, not far from Davie St. Quick check in. Good front desk service-24 hrs. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Clean. Help desk for tourists. CONS: Could hear noise from the street on the Friday and Saturday nights. Rooms not sound proof. Bathrooms quite small. Late night in room dining lacking. Expensive internet. $9/hr, look for cheaper places in the west end of Robson St $2-3/hr. Overall, good if you want a clean and comfortable place to sleep at reasonable price. Staff very friendly, especially Jessie.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: thorly
Reviews.Content: This was a decent and affordable place with a good location. The first room they gave us was on the top floor, across from the elevator. It was very loud, so they showed us several other rooms and let us pick where we would like to move. I wouldn't say this place is anything special, but it is clean, quiet and friendly. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad first impression”
Reviews.Author: Zoula
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel after reading the reviews written by other travelers in this website. Check in was accurate and very fast. I was given a room at the fourth floor. My first impression when the lift doors opened was OMG, this floor stinks. At the same time, I noticed that a few rooms (perhaps three) on that wing of the hotel was converted into some sort of retail/ bride shops which gave me a very bad impression. The smell at the fourth floor was as if the floor was flooded and the carpet did not dry properly. The smell faded while walking towards my room, but was still there... For the housekeeping, most of the time, you will need to wash the coffee maker yourself because it is not there job to do it after all and perhaps depending on the person doing the cleaning. I had some problems in configuring the internet so I asked for assistance. I received a phone call within less than 5 minutes from some support lady who obviously knew what she was doing. She asked me to do some configuration and dealing with me as if I had no experience at all (which is good). My problem was solved. Speaking of the internet, yes, it is true they do provide free high speed internet which is controlled and throttled if you exceed a certain bandwidth usage.
