I downloaded a 50Mb file to update some software and after 25 Mb the bandwidth dropped from >200 kbs to 15Kbs . I called to complain about the situation and the person in charge had to request for a special approval from the hotel to remove the control of bandwidth. By the time they put it back to normal, the file was downloaded. My message is that if you are looking for free flow of internet, it is not. It is controlled and you would most probably not be able to use Skype or MSN Live to communicate. In my case, internet is a very important tool. The pool (which I did not use) did not seem to be adequate for kids as it is deep. Adults supervision would be required at all time. Like, the adults would have to be in the pool at all time. I had dinner once at the restaurant, it is nice and clean. Service was fast , the waitress was pleasant and the food was good. I had my breakfast outside all the time since there were a lot of choices at lower prices. It is true that the location is good. There weren't many homeless people since it was still summer I guess, many times I got stopped by people on the street asking me for 10 dollars for many different reasons, but this has nothing to do with the hotel of course. Taking in consideration the price I have paid (CAD159 to 200 per night) and the hotel condition, I would certainly not stay in the Holiday Inn Downtown Vancouver as I could stay in more presentable hotels in the same area and at the same or slightly cheaper rates. I hope this review would help. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: MoDo91
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice central location. Our room was very roomy, clean and comfortable for 3 persons. The staff was very friendly and helped us with all questions. We can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location to discover downtown vancouver”
Reviews.Author: engineer777
Reviews.Content: this was my familys second visit to vancouver and we stayed at the same holiday inn because of its great location.everything is close by within walking distance and the rooms are ideal for the price you pay.the front desk staff were very helpful and the maid service was top dollar compared to many hotels i have stayed around the world.no request was to much touble for the hotel staff.we visited all the local attractions and found the hotel a relaxing place to return to after a day out .all the food shops are close by and using a day travel pass on the public transport made the hotel an ideal place to stay for 5 or 6 days.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Italtraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel but not excellent. The room was clean enough, comfortable and the help desk is very kind. The location is fantastic because you are in the center of Vancouver; overall in the night the area around the hotel is not bad: Hastings St, full of homeless, is not very close but if you have a car I really suggest to use the hotel garage (with 15 CAD). For the price you spend this hotel it's a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than the brand”
Reviews.Author: spoons74
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn doesnt enjoy the best reputation in North America - this was certainly one of the best Holiday Inn's i'd laid to rest in. The location is excellent - close to everything, including the hospital where i could lighten myself of $715 for the dr to look at my sprained ankle. Never mind. Its also close to Davie st, known as the gay district, though really just home to lots of life (and unfortunately some homeless who move to Vancouver to survive the winter. One tried to lighten me of my pizza). The staff were limited in numbers, though very helpful. Patrick even offered to lend me crutches without asking. good form. The rooms (we had a standard twin) were newly refurbished and excellent. Large beds and the best matress i had in north america. all the little things like great robes and free high speed if youre using your laptop. Reception happily sent faxes and printed material for me without charge. I like a hotel that doesn't nickel and dime me. The only downside was the idiot who stayed previously setting about 7 alarms through the night which kept waking me from my comfy bed slumber. I didnt try the restaurants. Definitely I would recommend this for a mid market option. As for Vancouver - read my write up about the Sandman Suites on Davie - lots of good tips from the Spoons there! need more, drop me a line. Love in travel Spoons xx

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the money”
Reviews.Author: Deal_Catcher
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was clean and close to Business center. The view was nice and the staff helpful. It is your average hotela and what you would expect from 'Holiday Inn'. If you are on a budget, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms... Close to West End..”
Reviews.Author: MindyBMind
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after a cruise. We had 2 rooms and they were adjoining, which was great! The parking was kind of hard since we had rented a large SUV to take all of us and our luggage around. The staff was less then helpful when looking for a place to eat. We eneded up finding a place, but we had to walk several blocks with my grandfather who doesn't walk well. We could have been better off loading up in the car and drove someplace. I didn't like having to pay for parking, either.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here! You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: xcskierx4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a hotel in Vancouver handy to public transportation, near the park if possible, and a place to spend a little time in Vancouver. We were surprised and delighted at the value you get here at the HI Vancouver. Incredibly friendly staff, helpful and knowledgeable - they clearly "get it" when it comes to guest service. The room was very clean and having a choice of pillow firmness was a wonderful touch. In fact we'd just come from 5 nights at the Chateau Whistler and the beds/pillows were much more comfortable here! I would not hesitate to stay here again and for longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service....”
Reviews.Author: DebiLynn706
Reviews.Content: my stay here was great....the staff couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating from silly questions regarding accessing internet until the help i needed to get my luggage to the curb for the shuttle (i am a little physically challenged)....the restaurant and staff there are very nice and the food very good..... i had no trouble getting around from that location...quite close to everything or close to bus or trolley stops....my room was very nice, quiet and immaculately clean....the elevators were quite punctual (i might ask for a room closer to the elevators as it was a bit of a trek for me but the hotel was worth it)....the price was reasonable at $104/night (through the website) for the security and comfort i felt there; i enjoyed my stay hoping to return to this hotel in beautiful Vancouver in the fall....thank you for being so helpful and making my get-away grand (would also like to say that although i didnt stay in a wheelchair accessible room, i was glad to see the handrail in the shower)..

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine”
Reviews.Author: tvnewseditor
Reviews.Content: We were assigned this hotel through a hotwire booking. We paid $35 US for a room that retails for $99 CAD. The hotel was very conveniently located close to downtown sights. This is not a luxury hotel. It is a nice place, but nothing to rave about. However, it served our needs perfectly and would absolutely stay there again if I were emrely looking for a palce to lay my head at night. The room was clean and neat. Each of the 2 double beds had a pair of firm and a pair of soft pillows. Ice machine was conveniently located on our floor. On-site secure parking is $15 CAD. The parking garage is kinda small and cramped and there was a lot of tinted broken glass in one of the parking spaces, leading me to believe that a car had been broken into at some point. We parked anyway and our car was safe - although covered in bird poop after less than 24 hours. Didn't try the restaurant so can't say how the food was. Front desk service was quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “This Holiday Inn is awesome”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravellerBC
Reviews.Content: Living on an island just outside of Vancouver we were looking for a place to stay for 2 nights over Christmas while visiting friends and relatives in Vancouver. After a great reception and speedy checkin procedure, we went to our room (701)....a bed-sitting room. So nice to have a sitting area along with a bedroom separated by an innovative folding screen. I called down to the desk to get the password for their free internet access. So nice to be able to be connected (never leave home without my laptop). After a wonderful dinner at my niece's we returned to the hotel for a great sleep. In the morning, it was so nice to have the arched shower curtain rod but I loved the shower curtain itself. This is the first hotel that I've seen a shower curtain that you know is laundered at every checkout... it has snaps that the curtain can easily be changed. Just gave a nice feeling of cleanliness. We had guests come for brunch. What a delight! The waitress, Candy, was amazing! Even though we selected the buffet, her service was awesome. Coffee was served in thermos' on the table but you had to be really quick to be able to pour your own coffee. She was always there. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. Very fresh fruit, great selection of cereals and yogurts. Nice crispy bacon and sausages complimented the scrambled eggs (but Candy made sure we knew we could order virtually any other style of eggs we wanted ....and lo and behold.....over easy were actually over easy!). The make your own waffle maker was wonderful and the blueberries or strawberry toppings were a great addition. The next day, we had planned to take another friend to the Fairmont for brunch but after Candy's service, we returned to the Holiday Inn's dining room for another wonderful repeat. We will definitely return and will recommend the Vancouver downtown Holiday Inn to all of our island neighbour's.

Reviews.Title: “Very mixed opinion of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linzini
Reviews.Content: OK and polite staff (not over helpful or knowledgable about Vancouver though - we got more help in the Pharmacy up the road...) and both public areas and bedroom were clean and comfortable. The pool is OK - no changing rooms, change poolside. Restaurant inside and attached one next door are very nice - lucky, because you are not near many other options. But my god the bedrooms are hot! The whole heating system is apparently turned on or off centrally and there is a single thermostat - they told us they couldn't turn the heating off in our room because the public areas would get cold. The thermostat must be on "bake". No room controlled air con at this time of year. They did give us a fan as soon as we requested - not a huge help though. So we boiled in bed. The window opened, but even with earplugs the sounds from the street (and the drunk revellers walking past) are exceedingly loud. This happened every night, and when the drunk concert finished, the street cleaning machine and buses started. Not a lot of sleep. The location is convenient but earlier reviewers are correct, the area to the south and east is dodgy with some real "characters" on the street. A woman was thrown out of the hotel lobby for soliciting (her client too). However there is easy connection to streetcars, buses, and we walked to Granville Island, China Town, Gas Town and Canada place very easily from here. It's OK, safe and comfortable, but not very restful! Probably would try other hotels first.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with HI”
Reviews.Author: TedandKaren
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at 4 other hotels on this trip, the Holiday Inn was a sight for sore eyes(and back). So many hotels are nickel and diming us, we are seldom really happy with a hotel, any any price. The HI hasn't charged me extra for anything, gave me early check-in, free internet (that works well), and has a great concierge . Add to that the awesome staff, including the pair of Andreas, an exceptionally clean and comfortable room, and a great location. I feel I was welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, clean, comfortable and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: SimiDan
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn and Suites in downtown Vancouver, BC is located conveniently to restaurants, museums and shopping. The rooms are recently remodeled and the beds are quite comfortable with several types of pillows - firm, gentle firm and soft. They offer free Wi-Fi internet access and have two workstations in the lobby which are convenient and free for printing online boarding passes. Secure underground parking is provided at a reasonable rate. My last stay was the third time I've stayed there, and will continue to use this hotel on my future travels to Vancouver. Visit [--]

Reviews.Title: “Close to downtown sights”
Reviews.Author: palmspr_flyer
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Aug 31st and stayed for three nights. Room was ready when I got there. Front Desk staff was very friendly. Room was on the 6th floor and was very nice. King Size bed, small loveseat, desk and small bathroom with nice fluffy towels and great shower. Had breakfast in hotel restaurant. Wait staff was very attentive and friendly too! Everything was just what I needed for my stay in Vancouver. Hotel is located within walking distance to Davie St, Robson Street and the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “I expected better”
Reviews.Author: SeatoSky22
Reviews.Content: Our room was small, hot, and smelled of urine (#502). There was even a air purifier in our room when we went in, the housekeeper followed us in and took it out. Desk clerk was rude and not much help.Due to a unremovable lock the only window would not open more then an inch. We had breakfast in the restaurant, was very good and the waitress was super friendly. Centerally located, but certainly not worth nearly $250.00 a night !! Look elsewhere if you can.

Reviews.Title: “location slightly offputting but generally fine”
Reviews.Author: CleethorpesGtfcfan
Reviews.Content: staye dhere for one week in august hotel is at dodgy end of granville street and if walking to town should go down howe street it is a 10 15 minute walk.also dining options close to hotel are limited.that said for english guests the food is very reasonable and of good quality generally the staff are very friendly and helpful.the swimming pool is unattended has no changing room or jacuzzi and is rather cold.this is the best situated hi for downtown and reasonably priced.a word of warning about downtown vancouver the area between gastown and chinatown is very unpleasant and walking directly betwen the two is not to be recommended

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: TheSusilos
Reviews.Content: We stay for 3 nights on beginning of August. Good location, since it was easy to go to tourist attractions by bus and easy to find restaurants. Unfortunately the service was poor especially the house keeping, they cleaned the room even when we put "DO NOT DISTURB" sign on the door knob and they didnt do their job very well. Based on our experiences with Holiday Inn Hotel chain, we can say this one is the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: 5Sally5
Reviews.Content: Good, central location within walking distance of Robson Street, Vancouver Art Gallery, Canada Place etc. Comfortable, spacious room. Very strange bathroom arrangement which we didn't much like - the washbasin was in a separate alcove of the bedroom, with the toilet and bathtub (with good shower over) in an ensuite. Very, very comfortable bed - bliss. Helpful, friendly staff. The downsides were the slow, cramped elevators, and the restaurant. We had breakfast one morning but it was truly awful and rather expensive. We then discovered so many much better places to eat breakfast, very close by. We ate one night at the Kettle of Fish - very good, but surprisingly unfriendly staff (our experience is that almost all other Canadians we have encountered have been very pleasant). Another night we ate in the wonderful Delilah's which is a very nice walk of about ten blocks through residential streets - it was such a nice walk that we walked both ways, even though we were tired from walking all day sightseeing. The great cocktails and superb meal at Delilah's, not to mention the wonderful service, really bucked us up.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: molliecat
Reviews.Content: First three nights of a Vancouver and the Rockies tour, Good location rooms very clean and the staff so helpfull. Good resturant just a short walk was the moose down under great food and again great staff no complants at all

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: Teramo48
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night during a Rocky Mountaineer Vacation. Nice, clean room (#714) with king size bed and complimentary slippers. Small bathroom. Lot of noise from the elevator and kids. Seedy looking street behind the hotel, but a selection of restaurants in the neighborhood on the front side. We had a delicious meal at the Kettle of Fish about 3-4 blocks away. Interestingly there was a lot of ambulance activity in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Stef1940
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an ideal location for seeing all the local attractions. Easy access to Sky-train, buses sea-taxis and walking to various destinations. The hotel rooms were large, with King size beds and the usual facilities. Staff very helpful and friendly, overall a very good Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hot as Hell”
Reviews.Author: hafnerfan
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Downtown Vancouver is a centrally located hotel within walking distance of many sites to see. The problem is the hotel is old and needs to be refurbished. Additionally, the air-conditioning does not work adequately in the summer and our room (Room 507) was extremely hot. The hotel staff was not helpful at all and just kept telling us to "open the window", maybe in the winter that suggestion would have worked, but in June it was of no assistance at all. The front desk staff appear to be college kids who do not have guests interest at heart. The hotel appears to have no security as we heard fighting in the hall ways from what appeared to be a domestic dispute at 3 and 4 in the morning. Loud screeming and banging of the walls do not allow guests to adequately sleep. This happened on two of the three nights we stayed at the hotel. The one bright spot is the restaurant which serves an excellent dinner. The restaurant staff is pleasant as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate for a short stay!”
Reviews.Author: Honest-Jim
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn is fairly standard Holiday Inn fare, which means no strong plusses, but no particular minuses either. However, it also means you can go there in the complete confidence that you will have a clean room and a comfortable bed for the night. The room we were allocated was an upgrade, and very large – about double the norm, with a three piece suite and a conference table with six chairs. The bed was very large and comfortable. Effective air conditioning is provided, with the added bonus of being able to open the window if you prefer. Although clearly marked as a non smoking room, it seemed that the previous occupant had smoked in the room as there was some of that horrible residual smell. The bathroom was surprisingly cramped with the shorter than average bathtub governing the overall size. Overall, the room was OK, but was starting to look a bit on the tired side. Although situated on a busy street, we did not find traffic noise to be a problem with the window closed and the air-con on. (We were also on the 7th floor which no doubt helped). We only ever had breakfast in the hotel; these were excellent with a good choice of both cooked and the ‘healthy’ option. I particularly liked the eggs being cooked to order and I thought reasonable value for money at around CDN$12-15 (depending on whether you had ‘cooked’ or the ‘healthy’ option). Service was excellent, even providing you with paper cups to take away any tea or coffee. One observation was the size of the two lifts – they were very small. This caused a lot of difficulty when people were leaving with luggage, given that only about 4 people with luggage could squeeze in at a time. I noted people getting in the lift on the ‘up’ cycle in sheer frustration! I found staff, whether waiting, reception, bar and the person on the Information Desk to be attentive, helpful and provided good service. We had a look at the indoor swimming pool – rather a tortuous route to get to it! I would describe it more as a leisure pool – you couldn’t really swim in it on account of its size and odd shape, but everything seemed clean and in order. This hotel is well located, with most downtown places being walkable. It also has the advantage of being right on the route of the Airport Bus. There are several restaurants nearby and one of them is rated quite highly in Tripadvisor’s Restaurants listing – Bin 941 Tapas Parlour on Davie Street (at most 5 mins walk from hotel). It was excellent – a great atmosphere and good value for money food. I was surprised that it was so busy at 6.30pm on a Wednesday – a good sign I suppose; we had to wait 20 mins for a table, but were able to have a drink while we waited. It was worth the wait. In summary, I would be perfectly happy to stay here again; the hotel was clean, comfortable, well located with a good standard of service at a reasonable price. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MelSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Holiday Inn for 3 nights while in Vancouver visiting my mom in hospital. My sister had already been in hotel for a week and was very happy with everything. Was pleasantly surprised by the great restaurant in hotel (didn't need to go anywhere else) as the food was reasonably priced and very good. The rooms were pretty typical hotel rooms, but very clean. My sister stayed on the executive level for the first few nights and really enjoyed the room. We had to move as they were booked for the weekend that I stayed there. Room was fine, but for a non-smoking room it really smelled like smoke. We were unable to open our window as we figured out the main outside smoking deck was just below and wow, was there ever a lot of smoke that came into the room! The staff was great - would definitely stay there again- just not in any of the rooms near the smoking deck!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: sproutandthebean
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night only on arrival in Vancouver, before we headed down to Seattle on The Quick Shuttle (which collects & returns from outside this hotel). The room was clean, the breakfast was pretty good with plenty of choices and the evening meal was ok. We had lunch in the bar before leaving the hotel and the staff were happy to let us share a meal, as the portions were quite generous. Waiting and bar staff extremely helpful and friendly. Well located for visitor attractions, shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Solid good hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: advcardio
Reviews.Content: Better than expected! We stayed on the executive level (floors 7 or 8) for one night for business. We found the beds to be new with updated furniture then the last time we visited. The room was large enough to have a king bed, be able to set out our papers, a table, a comfort chair and foot stool and free internet use in the rooms. The hotel has internet on 2 computers downstairs in the lobby but you pay for that. We used room service and all the staff were very friendly and the food was delievered fast (20 minutes) and hot too! For an american full breakfast plus tip (already in the bill 15 %) it was less than 15.00 CAD. The hotel parking was less expensive than most downtown hotels and less than 20.00. The pros; Quiet CLEAN room, great beds (new), choice of pillows, free in room internet and a very nice group of employees. Decent room service prices. The cons; Pay per use internet in the lobby-even if its to check your airline flight. In a nutshell; Good solid hotel for short stay, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: theboogs
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, although we only stayed one night, it was clean, very friendly staff, great bed and close to walk to many things. The restaurant on site had very good food, also and very nice waitresses.

Reviews.Title: “So - So”
Reviews.Author: TravelNotTourism
Reviews.Content: On the plus side: (1) Location is within walking distance (10-20 minutes) of such major downtown sites and areas such as Robson Square and Canada Place (2) Price is reasonable for a clean, reasonably comfortable mid-range hotel in a major city (3) Staff were extraordinarily friendly and seemed genuinely glad to see you... On the negative side: (1) I found significant traffic noise, even though I was on the sixth (executive) floor. (2) It seemed to take ages to get hot water for the bath. (3) Front desk staff sometimes gave information which wasn't complete, or inaccurate. For instance, it would have been helpful for them to tell me that the theatre ticket I had for one evening meant my venturing into a questionable area of the city after dark. Estimates of walking times to various locations was more than once, considerably off (i.e. significantly underestimated) - and I walk at a reasonably brisk pace. (4) I found the pool very small, and it's located in a rather isolated part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BCTripper07
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Holiday Inn Downtown Vancouver at the beginning of our month trip through BC. We had terrible jet lag after 2-day flight from Australia so we would have been happy with anything for the first night. However, we were pleasantly suprised by the standard. We found the desk clerks to be very friendly and helpful as well as their restaurant staff. The rooms themselves were dated and could do with a revamp but we generally they were very comfortable and couldn't complain for the cost of the room. The location was terrific and we managed to get to all the major attractions either by walking or public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malky15
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and spacious. Food was great. Staff were really nice and helpful, particularly the bar, restaurant and laundry staff. We stayed for eight nights and built a rapport with many of the staff. In addition to the quality of the hotel and the staff it is also in a great central location. I will definitely be staying here again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Average Lodging”
Reviews.Author: gringita_ck
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as part of a rail vacation package. Not exactly fancy but the rooms were clean and the staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spacious hotel in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: NayKat
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel right at downtown. Stayed there for 2 nights to attend a wedding. Paid about $179 per night. Didn't use any facilities. If is not for the wedding, would probably opt for other locations not in downtown since we rented a car anyways. (to save a few dollars)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: peter84
Reviews.Content: The holiday inn in downtown vancouver is my favourite hotel to stay in downtown vancouver. It has many facilities included in it including a pool, fitness centre, and restaurant. My first stay I got an executive room on the 6th floor with king size bed, sofa and tv. My second stay I got a room with a murphy bed, kitchenette and bathroom with shower only. The view from the room wsa great as it was a corner room with floor to ceiliing windows. The staff at this hotel are excellent and I will be staying here again in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “vancouver”
Reviews.Author: bugsbunny6
Reviews.Content: very central to all in Vancouver Hotel clean & tidy, city tour bus stops outside. worth going to capilano can be done on the public transport, local ferry than bus.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go along with the 'OK' rating”
Reviews.Author: JayPDee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on two separate nights with a gap in the middle for our trip to the beautiful Victoria. Both nights were Priority Club reward nights (i.e. free) and, unusually for such redemptions, we were given a suite. For us Europeans this suite was on the large side (see pics) with all the amenities you could wish for, less a minibar (which I found quite strange). The hotel itself seemed very busy and the first night of our stay we ate a bar snack (we arrived quite late). The waiter was very accomodating if a little rushed off his feet, poor chap! We found the pool but weren't staying at this hotel so we could swim. The hotel was within reasonable walking distance of main downtown (around 15 minutes), plus around 5-10 minutes away from the trendy Gastown restaurants. The service was excellent and we would consider staying here again, although I have the feeling there is probably somewhere better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped on Canada Day”
Reviews.Author: TacomaGuys
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Downtown Vancouver June 29 and 30 leading off the Canada Day weekend. It was a spur of the moment trip from our home in Tacoma, WA; we booked only 3 nights in advance, and it was Canada's national day... so we weren't surprised to pay CDN$159 per night. We were surprised, however, that for $159 our room had only a murphy bed, the kind that folds into a wall. Of course, the hotel was full and there were no other rooms. To the hotel's credit, the room did have a kitchenette, but we didn't need that so we used the kitchen space to store our suitcases and the barstools that had to be moved there in order to open the bed. Shower was very small and difficult to maneuver in and juggle soap, shampoo, conditioner, etc. Bathroom was very clean. Our end of the hotel was clean and quiet, although it is a bit confusing to navigate. There are multiple elevator banks that stop on slightly different levels - sometimes between levels so you still have to walk up or down short flights of stairs to get to/from rooms. Great open terrace on the second floor to socialize, smoke, and people watch. There were families playing card games. Hikers resting tired feet. Couples. Young and old. A great mix. Great location close to Granville Island, Robson Street, and Davie Street. No shortage of restaurants, bars, and entertainment in walking distance. And for us, the biggest plus was a Starbucks on the opposite corner. The garage is convenient, under the building. A tight squeeze for a mid-size pickup. My main advice: make sure you know what type of room you are reserving before you confirm. If I had known we'd be in a murphy bed, I would have considered paying $30 or $40 more at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “After reading this you may not want to stay here”
Reviews.Author: MacSpaceDude
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this poor excuse for a Holiday Inn recently and we thought we would share our stay experience. Please note that we were there for 9 nights and kept telling ourselves "it can't get any worse"...until it did. I would like to mention that although our stay was poor overall that the hotel was clean, the bed was comfortable (although very, very high off of the floor) and the front desk agents were pleasant but that's about it. The hotel room that we were in was a single queen room at $186 per night which is extremely overpriced for a 3.5 star hotel but we thought it was worth while considering it was central downtown...we were wrong. The hotel room was in shaby shape(ie: the carpet and bathroom were old, the toilet kept backing up, the iron and board were dirty), the toilet paper was of the cheapest variety, the towels were like sand paper, the restaurant was a make-shift dinning room right off of the lobby and closed promptly at 9pm every night. Five out of the nine nights that we stayed we were awoken by the maid vaccuuming in the hallway and one morning the bellman mixed up our room with a "preferred guest program" room and after welcoming us and giving us water and chocolate said "oops wrong room" and took everything back. When we brought some of these issues up with management the response was "we'll check with housekeeping". In short nothing was done and we were not compensated. I would not stay here again and urge you not to even try.

Reviews.Title: “If I had Paid Full Price.....”
Reviews.Author: cosette13
Reviews.Content: I won this hotel on hotwire for $59, and to me, this is a $59 hotel and nothing more. If I had paid full price I would have been disappointed. This is an older hotel with a newer wing. The hotwire rooms are, of course, in the older part. We tried to check in at 1:30pm but were told no rooms would be ready until 2:30 or 3pm. We went for lunch and came back at 2:45, where we were told there were no rooms ready. I said "So for the last hour and 45 mins your housekeeping staff have not been cleaning rooms? Do they plan to clean the entire hotel in the next 15 mins so people can check in?". I mean seriously, this was a MONDAY night. Not a weekend night of a big concert in town or something. Well guess what? They found a room that was ready. Go figure. Room was basic. I have stayed in motels with similar furnishings. Typical Holiday Inn. Not a box of kleenex to be found anywhere though! Coffee maker, mini bar, desk, chair, 2 double beds. The standard stuff. We only needed a clean place to crash that night and it worked for that. I couldn't spend a few days there though. There was a cd player in the room, which was a nice touch, but unfortunately I didn't have any cds with me. My daughter wanted to go to the pool, so we went down. You have to take the elevator to floor 2, then walk down about 4 flights of stairs to get to the pool. Not wheelchair friendly at all. The pool is odd - it is up against a wall and they have painted a big whale on it. Its shaped like a lima bean and I didn't find it 'inviting' at all. We are huge swimmers, but I didn't really have the inclination to go in this pool for some reason. My daughter coaxed me in and it was FRIGID! This pool was not heated. Not even close! I don't know if thier heater is broken, or no one goes down all the flights of stairs to use it so they don't bother to heat it, or what...but do not go to this hotel if swimming is a priority! I stayed in for about 3 mins and realized I couldn't feel my feet they were so cold. My daughter's lips were turning blue and we got outta there pretty quick! When we went up to the room we actually had to put the heat on, put warm clothes and socks on, and make tea before we felt warm again. A little later my daughter (who is 11) really wanted to see the kids playroom. She didn't really want to play (she is too old for that), but I think curiousity was getting the better of her. We went there and its just a joke. Its an empty room with a little tikes climber in the middle. All around are old and disgusting toys I wouldn't be letting a small child play with - they looked like someone's garage sale or worse. It reminded me of one of those hospital playrooms they have for kids, only really OLD! We had room service dinner and breakfast and it was really good. Decent sized portions and prices were not too bad for room service. They do have in room movies, but we didn't watch one. Internet is free - which is a huge bonus. It was spotty at times, but 90% reliable. The funniest thing I noticed was the lotion, soap shampoo and conditioner - it was date stamped April 2005 and said Exp Period 18 months' Hmmmmmmmm I think you are overdue on getting new shampoo! (See photos - just had to share that one!). The bath products are very motel-ish and not up to the standards of the other big hotel chains. Again, for one night I didn't care. If you need somewhere to crash for one night and need it cheap, then go get this off hotwire - but don't pay full price. There are nicer places for the same price in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: ClivePNorthampton
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite (One Main entrance with two separate rooms) which was perfect for our family. ie. two young children. The hotel itself if good, not that modern but clean and whilst a new interior would be good, it didn't affect our holiday. The staff at the conceige desk were very good, helpfully and friendly, the rooms were kept very clean and the restaurant serves a good menu at a reasonable price. We also used room service which again was good. Overall it's a good hotel in a good location which offers good value for money and the staff help to make it a good experience. Whilst there are other major hotels around but more expensive, I would recommend this hotel to friends due to price,location and good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Quite adequate...”
Reviews.Author: jbushie
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Downtown is in a location that could be better... around the corner from the noisy bars of Granville Street (although that may be desirable!) and near a few down-and-out buildings. However, it is a few blocks easy walk from Sears and the shopping malls and from Robson, the main boutique shopping street. The Hop-ON Hop-Off Vancouver Sightseeing Trolley stops right outside as does the airport shuttle. There is a Starbucks opposite and great Lebanese down the street at the Bombay Cafe. I had been booked into the Holiday Inn as part of a Rocky Mointaineer package, at the "budget" level. It was certainly more than adequate for this standard. My room was large and well equipped., extremely clean and the beds are very comfortable. The bathroom was adequate although small. In the reception area, there is a small shop which sells souvenirs, and on the second floor there are several payphones (use cash, credit card or buy phone cards from reception-great value!) I didn't investigate any other facilities in my short stay. The reception staff are friendly and the woman at the information desk was especially helpful. She had a good knowledge of the city and even kept helping as we walked along the street on her way home! The staff in the dining room were good - especially Betty! The breakfasts were delicious (choice of continental buffet, full buffet, pancakes, waffles, fresh fruit.) I didn't eat in the restaurant in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: bcgirl62
Reviews.Content: Booked this stay as a "Rewards Night" with Priority Club. Everything about the stay and room was first-rate. We were upgraded to a lovely one-bedroom suite on the Executive Floor, and even received complimentary meal vouchers and the late check-out I needed. Every staff member we dealt with was very friendly and accomodating. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: i-love-holidayz
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Downtown is in a great location, just minutes from Robson, the main shopping street. It is within walking distance of Gastown and Waterfront Station (from which you can take the SkyTrain) and the Vancouver Sightseeing Trolley stops right outside. Also, the airport bus leaves from and goes to the hotel, and it only costs 13 dollars per person. There is a good Starbucks Cofee diagonally opposite, too! The rooms are large and equipped with an iron, an ironing board, a coffee maker, a tv from which you can access the internet, etc. They are extremely clean and the beds are very comfortable. In the reception area, there are two computers and a small shop which sells souvenirs, and on the second floor there are several payphones (use cash, credit card or buy phone cards from reception-great value!) There is also a swimming pool, which looked small but nice! The reception staff are friendly and the woman at the information desk was very helpful. She has a good knowledge of the city and she called several cabs for us. The staff in the dining room are lovely, too-very cheerful! The breakfasts were delicious (choice of continental buffet, full buffet, pancakes, waffles, etc) and the evening menu was limited, but the food was good! Overall, we had a fantastic holiday, and I would be more than willing to recommend the Holiday Inn Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “convienient”
Reviews.Author: spark48
Reviews.Content: we found this hotel to be convienient. we felt safe and the rooms were ok. the views were not great but it is a city centre. pool and gym were good.

Reviews.Title: “"Acceptable, but nothing special"”
Reviews.Author: Flying_Dutchguy
Reviews.Content: A negative point is that the Holiday Inn reservation told me that their executive rooms come along with access to their executive lounge. Still, there is no exec lounge in the entire hotel! Rooms are a bit old, but still clean and comfortable. The double beds are a bit small (I don't understand at all why hotels don't just offer at least Queen size beds). Hotel staff was in my case superfriendly, all of them! The hotel location is undoubtedly good, despite the fact that indeed 1.5 blocks away there is a nightclub (so what??). All in all it was a pleasant stay for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Solid”
Reviews.Author: passive649
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn through a hotwire booking for around $75 per night - and for this rate I would recommend it to anyone. The room was comfortable, the free internet (not wireless) and daily papers were nice touches. With a swimming pool, fitness room and onsite restaurant this place covered most bases. We were about 4 rooms away from the lift and could still hear it going up and down all night, so I would check that the room you are being put in isnt any closer as it might annoy you.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Judy_in_Calgary
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Holiday Inn Vancouver Downtown in July 2006. We were looking for a moderately priced hotel that was clean, comfortable, centrally located, with secure parking. We got what we wanted, and we would stay there again. The only challenge we experienced was parking in the entrance area when we arrived and wanted to check in. We arrived in the late afternoon, when several other guests also were arriving. Things were a bit crowded in front of the hotel, but we managed to park in the semi-circular driveway. The reception staff promptly gave my husband a card to operate the automatic gate for the underground parking garage, and the challenge was short-lived. After that, our stay at the Holiday Inn was comfortable. The reception area was pleasant and well supplied with tourist brochures and computer screens that explained Vancouver's tourist attractions. However, we did not avail ourselves of that information, as we were repeat visitors to Vancouver. The hotel is located half a block from Davie Street, on which there are a lot of reasonably priced restaurants. In the other direction it's three blocks from Robson Street, on which there are many shops and restaurants, some moderately priced and some upscale. . We are middle aged, and we had no difficulty in walking to the English Bay Promenade and to Stanley Park and back again. We felt comfortable walking in the vicinity of the hotel both in daylight hours and after dark. The room had two queen-sized beds. It had a television set, a coffee maker, iron and hair dryer. It was air conditioned. Although we did not use it, we noticed that it had an Internet connection. The bathroom had a tub / shower, and it was clean and well appointed. Our room was next to an elevator, and we feared that we might be disturbed by elevator noise. However, we were pleasantly surprised. We did not hear the elevator at all. The curtains were well lined so that they did not let in the morning sunlight. However, there was a little triangular wedge near the top where the curtains did not quite meet. I knew from previous experience that the light coming through that little triangular wedge probably would be enough to waken me early in the morning. I always travel with a clothespin or safety pin for that very reason. However, I found that, if I closed the curtains asymetrically, they closed fully. That is, I did not pull them towards each other in the middle. Rather, I pulled one of the drapes more than half way, and that did the trick. Every morning we found a complimentary copy of the Globe and Mail newspaper outside of our door. The hotel had an onsite restaurant, which we did not use. It had an indoor swimming pool and an exercise room, which we also did not use. We rarely interacted with the reception staff but, when we did, they were friendly and efficient. They checked us in and out promptly, and were quick to order a cab for us when we asked for one. The hotel is not on the waterfront. Our room faced other highrise buildings and, as such, did not have an especially scenic view. That did not bother us. As I mentioned before, we were repeat visitors to Vancouver, and we were looking for a hotel that was clean, comfortable and moderately priced. We actually got more than we were expecting. However, the lack of a view may bother some first time visitors. Speaking for ourselves, we would be willing to stay at Holiday Inn Vancouver Downtown again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very Rude Desk Clerk, nice Information Desk. Closet Gift Shop and workout room, small but cute pool. Blood on pillows, bums were having sex outside the window, one block from strip clubs, no towels in the room, a/c was absolutely horrible, had to ask for a fan. Dining staff rude. Several blocks to 7 block shopping mall and a bus ride away from Granville Island and Stanley Park, love both attractions. Parking is secured by a 8 ft fence with razor wire, tells how safe the area is. Have to admit the pizza from room service was wonderful. Night time staff much nicer than daytime staff.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: AlisonN
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the first three nights of a 14 day tour. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. I was especially impressed by the provision of international sockets meaning that we didn't need to use our adapters. The restaurant was always busy, but we were found a table at all times without having to wait too long. The staff were excellent and found time for a smile and a friendly word even when they were rushed off their feet. I would have preferred a slightly more central location. My mother is 78 and though she enjoys a walk, she found getting around on foot hard work. Absolutely fine for the young and fit though!

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: cl1811
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night early June 2006. Upon arrival the parking lot gate was shut and a "Full" sign was posted. If I hadn't been so tired from a long drive I would have thought to leave the car under the porte cochere and go inside to ask for help. Instead, I found a metered parking spot on the street and walked back to ask the desk clerk for help. She told me how to get the gate to open and gave me a parking pass. The lot was full for public parking but available for hotel guests. Some renovations are going on in public areas and hallways. I had booked the least expensive room. I was given what looks to be the parlor section of a 2-room suite. The room had a bar with sink, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, cooktop, and cupboards with dishes and cookware. Chair and sofa and two barstools. Once the Murphy bed was opened it was cramped for space, but I had paid for their cheapest room. The bathroom was larger than expected with a stall shower and a good supply of amenities. A folddown ironing board was behind the door and an umbrella was also provided. Clean room. Murphy bed was comfortable. Desk staff were efficient and courteous. Neighborhood looked fine to me. The Bosman's Hotel down the block looks scruffy, but I did not feel unsafe walking from the Holiday Inn to Canada Place and back, even in the evening. The parking lot exits onto a scruffy public alley, but the lot is gated so I did not feel uncomfortable. Hotel is a long but not unreasonable walk to the cruise ship piers and convention centre at Canada Place. Shorter walk to shopping mall and Robson Street. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OhCurious1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn on Howe street from April 14-17th, 2006. I was hesistant at first coming to such a "popular" chain hotel, but all my worries subsided once we stepped foot in this hotel. Everyone was very pleasant and helpful. The hotel was going through some minor rennovations, so some of the signs directing you to rooms were laying on the ground and there were no base boards in the hallway (no big deal, just something I noticed). But other than that, the rooms were clean and decorated very nicey. The rooms were also very spacious with everything you needed right there: iron with full-size ironing board, fridge, toilettries, tv, internet connection, etc. My only two "complaints": we were in room 521, facing the street. The street noise was kind of loud and occassionaly I'd be awaken at night from sounds below (seemed like there was a bar or club or something nearby, I'd hear people on the streets), the bathroom was TINY. My BF and I couldn't stand in there together. This hotel is centrally located!! Few blocks to Robson street and a few to the Granville Island ferries. We didn't rent a car, so this was perfect for us! Everything within walking distance! My boyfriend and I would stay there again! :)

Reviews.Title: “beware the bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: croppyboy69
Reviews.Content: My first clue that there was going to be a problem is when the young man at the front desk kept fumbling with his computer trying to find our rooms that were reserved a month in advance, they gave them away. They finally, after 20 minutes, put us in 2 dingy shoe-box sized rooms and not the executive suites I paid for. I was told that it was my fault for booking on the national web site and not directly with them. (????) We had a long trip and just wanted a nice place to lay our heads. After asking the man if their were any other rooms he said no. I told him we were leaving and suddenly a young woman found 2 rooms. One a nice suite the other was o.k., not what we paid for. It took over 2 hours to get in our rooms after a long flight. Advice, find a hotel elsewhere if you expect decent service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: JamieEighteen
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline in the uk for £28 per night including taxes. Had previously stayed in the holiday inn on Broadway so wasn't put off by the mixed reviews this hotel gets. Arrived at 8 in the morning direct from an all night flight so it was great to be able to check in straight away and go for a sleep. Staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms clean and tidy. And yes the lifts are small but get over it, is that really a vital part of your stay?!! I didn't eat at the restaurant ( I found it overpriced) but there are numerous diners in the vicinity (White Spot etc) and found an excellent little place for breakfast on the corner of Howe and Davie. Good value for money run by a very friendly and helpful chinese lady. Buses are frequent and nearby, taxis are cheap and it's not far to walk into the heart of downtown. Would certainly return and will probably be back there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good position”
Reviews.Author: stevegos
Reviews.Content: This hotel is above standard. We had a very large room on the 5th floor. The room was quiet, comfortable and clean. The staff were friendly and the resturant good. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, slow elevators”
Reviews.Author: chileno1025
Reviews.Content: I got this place through Priceline for $50 US/night. Great location near Davie Street with nearby cheap eateries (mostly bad I'm afraid). I was able to check in at 1:15 pm and got a nice double room on the 5th floor. Bathroom was small, especially the shower, and there was no air ventilation. Making local phone calls is $.95 Canadian. The hotel itself was nice, but the 2nd floor recreation area was closed off due to a group convention of some kind. The elevators are small and slow. There were at least two occasions when people waiting for an elevator had to wait because of over crowding. Overall it was a pleasant experience and I enjoyed my 2 day excursion due in part to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: rossq
Reviews.Content: We were a little leary about booking this hotel based on past reviews about its seedy neighbourhood. We shouldn't have worried because the area around the hotel itself is not bad at all and only gets questionable a few blocks to the east. In fact the hotel is located centrally to all sightseeing and is a five minute walk to the shopping of Robson St. The hotel staff was very couteous and helpful to our needs,from room accomdation to restaurant and shopping selections. We asked for a higher floor non-smoking room. The room itself is typical Holiday Inn, nothing fancy but clean. Overall if you're looking for a moderate priced, centally located hotel then you should give this hotel some serious consideration. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent experience, I'd stay again.”
Reviews.Author: joshkspa
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel was good for me. I detest having to pay extra for parking ($11/day) but it's common in big cities as we all know. My first encounter at the front desk wasn't great--a snooty 20 something girl who never made eye contact once and every question or request I had seemed to put her out. But all the other hotel staff were very accomodating, including our sweet housekeeper. Rooms were very clean, tasteful, great view. My biggest annoyance was the electric "whir" of the elevator running day and night. We weren't even that close to the elevator but could hear it running constantly. Ask for a room far from the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it -- blocks away from 5*'s --”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Sam
Reviews.Content: I had an interesting experience here in Vancouver. I was here for work for a few days and stayed at the Sheraton Wall Centre (a 4 or 5 star property). I extended my trip by a few days and decided to use Priceline for this extension of my trip. Got the Holiday Inn Downtown Hotel & Suites. Price: $40 US. This Holiday Inn is just 2 blocks from the Sheraton I stayed at. Truth be told, this is an amazing deal for anyone who can get it on PriceLine. I checked online and for the same night, the rate was $140 CDN. The room is not as "modern" as it could be, but it is definitely big enough and clean. There's a lounge chair, desk and chair, king bed and ample lighting. Room is clean and so is bathroom. Shower curtain could be changed b/c it smells so I called the front desk and they changed it. The best thing about this room has to be that there's FREE internet in the room. The Sheraton charged 11 dollars for this. Sheraton also charges $22 a day for parking. Parking tips -- the Holiday Inn charges around 11 dollars for parking. You can park on the street after 8pm for free -- just be sure to move your car before 9am. This hote has a really bad fitness room (although if all you want is a cardio machine you might like it), there's a small pool, and sauna too. There's a gym nearby (called Fitness World) that'll charge $10 for a walk in fee for one day use. Over all, how can you go wrong for $40 US. Check out biddingfortravel if you want help to figure out which hotels you'll get on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “great location in the heart of things”
Reviews.Author: briel
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews I nearly cancelled, and I am so glad I didn't. The staff were friendly, informative and helpful, the wonderful bar hostess was an amazing mine of information. The room was clean and spacious, with a great view of "downtown life" and roof gardens. A short walk brings you to the river and river buses, which whisk you over to Granville island in moments, anywhere else a little longer but what great sights of the city. A walk along the shoreline takes you to great bars, beaches and eventually Stanley park. The hotel breakfast was no great shakes, but the surrounding area has lots of little places that have excellent food. The Pool was under construction, but it was 25 degrees outside. A really good hotel for a central base to see Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Good price, great location”
Reviews.Author: Kinnik
Reviews.Content: Hotel was above-average, but not more than that. Room was comfortable and clean. Breakfast buffet was OK, but not the best. Service was good, but not exceptional. It was, in other words, a Holiday Inn. If you're OK with that, and want a well located and relatively comfortable hotel that is reasonably cheap, then look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Not pleased at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The (first) room we were given was small and ridiculously HOT. The thermostat was hitting 30 degrees celsius (over 86 degrees fahrenheit). We could not get the heat to shut off (we turned it off but could still feel hot air flowing in lightly). We opened the window only to be welcomed with excessively loud traffic noise. After an hour, we left and as we were doing so, I ran into a maid. I asked her for her help and we went back to the room. She didn't know what was going on and said that she would send a maintenance person to check on it while we were out of the room. We came back about 1 1/2 hours later only to be greated with MORE heat. It was nuts. Someone had come in and put the system on high - only to be blowing out more heat full blast! I couldn't take it and called the front desk. A gentleman came up and he explained that the system can only be set on either heat or air conditioning and being that it was "winter", it was on heat. He brought in a little fan and stated that with the window open and fan on, it would quickly cool down. About 2 hours later, we went downstairs to eat and ran into this gentleman. He asked how the room was and I told him it was still insanely hot and there was no way I was going to be able to sleep with the window open (our room was right over the lobby on Howe Street). He said that if it was still bad when we went back, he would switch us. Well, an hour later, it was still really hot and stuffy so I went back downstairs and had them switch us into another room (there are 2 towers - adjoining - and this other tower has individual units rather than a central system). Great. They put us on the "executive" level. What was so disheartening though is that the second I opened the door to the new room, the overpowering odor of cigarette smoke came upon me. The room was much bigger and it was DEFINITELY cooler - but it absolutely reeked. By this time, it was 8:00 p.m. - I was tired - I had to get up at 4:00 a.m. the next morning anyway and I just resolved myself to knowing that this was not going to be a great stay. The AC was a little noisy, kinda old, but it worked. I had a horrible sleep because I kept waking up feeling like I couldn't breath because the room just had a stale, old, cigarette smell to it. And, yes, it was a "non smoking" room. I appreciated them moving me but I would not stay here again. Our meal in the hotel was very reasonable however the staff was a bit flaky. The hostess only gave us one menu and said she'd be back with another one (which took about 6 minutes - and it was NOT busy at all). The waiter didn't tell us the special (we overheard another waitress telling her customers - but this was after we had ordered), and he did not bring out dinner rolls. The other thing that irritated me is that I'm a Priority Club Member and am suppose to receive free room upgrades if they are available. Well, considering they were able to move me into an "executive room" because I was hot, this proved to me that this room was available to begin with and I should've been put into it in the first place. So much for being a club member. Lastly, just for anyone who cares, the 2 elevators near the lobby that access the tower with the central system, are very, very, small. It could barely hold me, my husband and 3 suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “We spent 5 nights here after an Alaskan Cruise”
Reviews.Author: PeterWaugh
Reviews.Content: As far as Hotels go this was a reasonable place. The room was a bit small for a 5 night stay but made up for it by being walking distance to everything. I made a mistake in getting a rental car as car parking is very limited at this hotel. But coming from Australia I was determined to see as much as I could outside of downtown. The restrauant was fine and there were other places to eat not too far away. Overall I would say it OK to stay but I'm not sure about having kids here though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 spent 3 nights at the Holiday Inn in December and had no complaints. Our room was clean and well presented, the bathroom adequate and the hotel facilities (including a small gym, room safe, etc) quite reasonable. Hotel staff were all helpful. The hotel is inexpensive (especially in comparison with prices we paid in the US) and is only a 5-10 minute walk from the heart of the city. The hotel's restaurant was a pleasant and inexpensive surprise. Our vegetarian daughter whose choice of meals throughout most of the US leg of our holiday was limited to vegetarian pizza was able to choose from a number of dishes and I was able to find something that resembled home cooking after a couple of weeks of pizza, hamburgers and hot dogs. We chose to eat breakfast around the corner in Davy (Davies?) Road in a cheap little cafe run by a Vietnamese couple. Nice food and very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: CANADANE73
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend get-a-way with our 4 kids. Friendly and caring staff. Air condition could be more quiet and pool not as deep for the little ones, but still the probably best value for your money in Vancouver Donwtown. We`ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a Kid-friendly or Handicapped accessible place!”
Reviews.Author: kidsmom95
Reviews.Content: We went to Vancouver because my 6 year old son required hip surgery. Once we got the okay from his doctor, his fondest wish was to stay at a nice hotel downtown and go swimming in a hotel pool. So, being a travel professional I knew Holiday Inn has a reputation as being kid-friendly. Vancouver is VERY expensive, particularly downtown. I was advised by the reservation clerk that this particular hotel on Howe Street had a pool and kiddie centre and the rate was around $200 a night. When we got there, the first thing that put me off was that it cost hotel guests $11.95 a day to park in the parkade, but the sign out front for other customers was $7.95! It was also nearly impossible to access our room, this place is like an intricate maze, with two elevators and stairs at the end of each hallway, so we actually had to take both elevators and backtrack somehow to get to the room. IF you are in a wheelchair or dragging a luggage cart its a major inconvenience! We were told the pool was on our floor, which is ridiculous. I had to carry my son, who was on crutches, down 3 flights of stairs to get to what I can only describe as the crappiest Holiday Inn pool I have ever seen! To some, (not me!) it may appear esthetically pleasing, its all glass enclosed, and really except for a very small deck with two chairs and a table, there is nowhere to stand let alone sit. Its two stories high sort of remeniscent of a dolphin tank at an aquarium or something, all tiled. 80% of the pool, which is small and round, is 9 feet deep. The rope partitioning the shallow end allowed for minimal frolicing in the shallow end and unless your kids are good swimmers you don't want to send them in 3 meter water with no pool side to grab onto if they get tired. The "Kid's Centre" is unsupervised, and consists of a little tykes play structure and some craft materials, not all that impressive either, but it would have sufficed if we could get into the room! Complaints that our key would not open the door fell on deaf ears. Even now, two weeks after our stay there, the Hotel failed to provide any kind of true customer service. The manager phoned me today because she read the negative comments on my survey card, and all she offered to do was take the cost of our dinner off the bill. Additionally she does not see the bigger issue of inaccesibility in the hotel as a problem and that is my real beef. Speaking of dinner in the Hotel restaurant, our service was poor and when we asked about the cakes in the display case we were told they were "over a week old" and really gross. Nice! If you are travelling to Vancouver with or without kids, stay away from this place! We ended up at the Ramada Inn at the airport in Richmond and it was superb, for a fraction of the price. The fact it is about 25 minutes from Downtown should not deter you, its definetly a far better place to stay!

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Vancouver Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 1110 Howe Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6Z1R2, Canada
